member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for Screen Space Reflections effect rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.OverrideFlags
member.summary: The flags for overriden properties.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.Intensity
member.summary: The effect intensity (normalized to range [0;1]). Use 0 to disable it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.TraceMode
member.summary: The reflections tracing mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.DepthResolution
member.summary: The depth buffer downscale option to optimize raycast performance. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.RayTracePassResolution
member.summary: The raycast resolution. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.BRDFBias
member.summary: The reflection spread parameter. This value controls source roughness effect on reflections blur. Smaller values produce wider reflections spread but also introduce more noise. Higher values provide more mirror-like reflections.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.RoughnessThreshold
member.summary: The maximum amount of roughness a material must have to reflect the scene. For example, if this value is set to 0.4, only materials with a roughness value of 0.4 or below reflect the scene.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.WorldAntiSelfOcclusionBias
member.summary: The offset of the raycast origin. Lower values produce more correct reflection placement, but produce more artifacts. We recommend values of 0.3 or lower.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.ResolvePassResolution
member.summary: The raycast resolution. Full gives better quality, but half improves performance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.ResolveSamples
member.summary: The number of rays used to resolve the reflection color. Higher values provide better quality but reduce effect performance. Use value of 1 for the best performance at cost of quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.EdgeFadeFactor
member.summary: The point at which the far edges of the reflection begin to fade. Has no effect on performance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.FadeOutDistance
member.summary: The effect fade out end distance from camera (in world units).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.FadeDistance
member.summary: The effect fade distance (in world units). Defines the size of the effect fade from fully visible to fully invisible at FadeOutDistance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.UseColorBufferMips
member.summary: "The input color buffer downscale mode that uses blurred mipmaps when resolving the reflection color. Produces more realistic results by blurring distant parts of reflections in rough (low-gloss) materials. It also improves performance on most platforms but uses more memory.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.TemporalEffect
member.summary: If checked, enables the temporal pass. Reduces noise, but produces an animated "jittering" effect that's sometimes noticeable. If disabled, the properties below have no effect.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.TemporalScale
member.summary: The intensity of the temporal effect. Lower values produce reflections faster, but more noise.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.TemporalResponse
member.summary: Defines how quickly reflections blend between the reflection in the current frame and the history buffer. Lower values produce reflections faster, but with more jittering. If the camera in your game doesn't move much, we recommend values closer to 1.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ScreenSpaceReflectionsSettings.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for Anti Aliasing effect rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.OverrideFlags
member.summary: The flags for overriden properties.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.Mode
member.summary: The anti-aliasing effect mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.TAA_JitterSpread
member.summary: The diameter (in texels) inside which jitter samples are spread. Smaller values result in crisper but more aliased output, while larger values result in more stable but blurrier output.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.TAA_Sharpness
member.summary: Controls the amount of sharpening applied to the color buffer. TAA can induce a slight loss of details in high frequency regions. Sharpening alleviates this issue. High values may introduce dark-border artifacts.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.TAA_StationaryBlending
member.summary: The blend coefficient for stationary fragments. Controls the percentage of history samples blended into the final color for fragments with minimal active motion.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.TAA_MotionBlending
member.summary: The blending coefficient for moving fragments. Controls the percentage of history samples blended into the final color for fragments with significant active motion.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.CAS_SharpeningAmount
member.summary: The sharpening strength for the Contrast Adaptive Sharpening (CAS) pass. Ignored when using TAA that contains own contrast filter.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.CAS_EdgeSharpening
member.summary: The edge sharpening strength for the Contrast Adaptive Sharpening (CAS) pass. Ignored when using TAA that contains own contrast filter.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.CAS_MinEdgeThreshold
member.summary: The minimum edge threshold for the Contrast Adaptive Sharpening (CAS) pass. Ignored when using TAA that contains own contrast filter.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AntiAliasingSettings.CAS_OverBlurLimit
member.summary: The over-blur limit for the Contrast Adaptive Sharpening (CAS) pass. Ignored when using TAA that contains own contrast filter.

member.summary: The default .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SceneRenderTask.Output
member.summary: The output texture (can be null if using rendering to window swap chain). Can be used to redirect the default scene rendering output to a texture.

member.summary: The actors source to use (configures what objects to render).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SceneRenderTask.RenderingPercentage
member.summary: The scale of the rendering resolution relative to the output dimensions. If lower than 1 the scene and postprocessing will be rendered at a lower resolution and upscaled to the output backbuffer.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SceneRenderTask.UpscaleLocation
member.summary: The image resolution upscale location within rendering pipeline. Unused if RenderingPercentage is 1.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.MainRenderTask

member.remarks: For Main Render Task its may be null because game can be rendered directly to the native window backbuffer. This allows to increase game rendering performance (reduced memory usage and data transfer). User should use post effects pipeline to modify the final frame.

member.summary: The global position of the view (Origin+Position).

member.summary: The position of the view (relative to the origin).

member.summary: The far plane.

member.summary: The direction of the view.

member.summary: The near plane.

member.summary: The view matrix.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.Projection
member.summary: The projection matrix.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.NonJitteredProjection
member.summary: The projection matrix with no camera offset (no jittering). For many temporal image effects, the camera that is currently rendering needs to be slightly offset from the default projection (that is, the camera is ‘jittered’). If you use motion vectors and camera jittering together, use this property to keep the motion vectors stable between frames.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.IV
member.summary: The inverted view matrix.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.IP
member.summary: The inverted projection matrix.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.IVP
member.summary: The inverted projection view matrix.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.Frustum
member.summary: The view frustum.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.CullingFrustum
member.summary: The view frustum used for culling (can be different than Frustum in some cases e.g. cascaded shadow map rendering).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.Pass
member.summary: The draw passes mask for the current view rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.IsOfflinePass
member.summary: Flag used by static, offline rendering passes (eg. reflections rendering, lightmap rendering etc.)

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.IsSingleFrame
member.summary: Flag used by single-frame rendering passes (eg. thumbnail rendering, model view caching) to reject LOD transitions animations and other temporal draw effects.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.IsCullingDisabled
member.summary: Flag used by custom passes to skip any object culling when drawing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.IsTaaResolved
member.summary: True if TAA has been resolved when rendering view and frame doesn't contain jitter anymore. Rendering geometry after this point should not use jitter anymore (eg. editor gizmos or custom geometry as overlay).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.StaticFlagsMask
member.summary: The static flags mask used to hide objects that don't have a given static flags. Eg. use StaticFlags.Lightmap to render only objects that can use lightmap.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.StaticFlagsCompare
member.summary: The static flags mask comparision rhs. Allows to draw objects that don't pass the static flags mask. Objects are checked with the following formula: (ObjectStaticFlags and StaticFlagsMask) == StaticFlagsMaskCompare.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.Flags
member.summary: The view flags.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.Mode
member.summary: The view mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.MaxShadowsQuality
member.summary: Maximum allowed shadows quality for this view

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ModelLODBias
member.summary: The model LOD bias. Default is 0. Applied to all the objects in the render view.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ModelLODDistanceFactor
member.summary: The model LOD distance scale factor. Default is 1. Applied to all the objects in the render view. Higher values increase LODs quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ShadowModelLODBias
member.summary: The model LOD bias. Default is 0. Applied to all the objects in the shadow maps render views. Can be used to improve shadows rendering performance or increase quality. [Deprecated on 26.10.2022, expires on 26.10.2024]

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.ShadowModelLODDistanceFactor
member.summary: The model LOD distance scale factor. Default is 1. Applied to all the objects in the shadow maps render views. Higher values increase LODs quality. Can be used to improve shadows rendering performance or increase quality. [Deprecated on 26.10.2022, expires on 26.10.2024]

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RenderView.TaaFrameIndex
member.summary: Temporal Anti-Aliasing jitter frame index.

member.summary: The rendering mask for layers. Used to exclude objects from rendering.

member.summary: Square of . Cached by rendering backend.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerFilter
member.summary: GPU sampler filter modes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerFilter.Point
member.summary: Filter using the nearest found pixel. Texture appears pixelated.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerFilter.Bilinear
member.summary: Filter using the linear average of the nearby pixels. Texture appears blurry.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerFilter.Trilinear
member.summary: Filter using the linear average of the nearby pixels and nearby mipmaps. Texture appears blurry.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerFilter.Anisotropic
member.summary: Filter using the anisotropic filtering that improves quality when viewing textures at a steep angles. Texture appears sharp at extreme viewing angles.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerFilter.MAX
member.summary: The count of items in the GPUSamplerFilter enum.

member.summary: GPU sampler address modes.

member.summary: Texture coordinates wrap back to the valid range.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerAddressMode.Clamp
member.summary: Texture coordinates are clamped within the valid range.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerAddressMode.Mirror
member.summary: Texture coordinates flip every time the size of the valid range is passed.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerAddressMode.Border
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside of the valid range will return a separately set border color.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GPUSamplerAddressMode.MAX

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.TextureBase
member.summary: Base class for , , and other assets that can contain texture data.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.Texture
member.summary: Gets GPU texture object allocated by the asset.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.Format
member.summary: Gets the texture data format.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.Width
member.summary: Gets the total width of the texture. Actual resident size may be different due to dynamic content streaming. Returns 0 if texture is not loaded.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.Height
member.summary: Gets the total height of the texture. Actual resident size may be different due to dynamic content streaming. Returns 0 if texture is not loaded.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.Size
member.summary: Gets the total size of the texture. Actual resident size may be different due to dynamic content streaming. Returns Float2.Zero if texture is not loaded.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.ArraySize
member.summary: Gets the total array size of the texture.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.MipLevels
member.summary: Gets the total mip levels count of the texture. Actual resident mipmaps count may be different due to dynamic content streaming.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.ResidentMipLevels
member.summary: Gets the current mip levels count of the texture that are on GPU ready to use.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.CurrentMemoryUsage
member.summary: Gets the amount of the memory used by this resource. Exact value may differ due to memory alignment and resource allocation policy.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.TotalMemoryUsage
member.summary: Gets the total memory usage that texture may have in use (if loaded to the maximum quality). Exact value may differ due to memory alignment and resource allocation policy.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.TextureGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the texture group used by this texture.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.HasStreamingError
member.summary: Returns true if texture streaming failed (eg. pixel format is unsupported or texture data cannot be uploaded to GPU due to memory limit).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.GetMipData(System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the mip data.
member.returns: The mip-map data or empty if failed to get it.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.GetPixels(FlaxEngine.Color32[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the texture pixels as Color32 array.
member.remarks: Supported only for 'basic' texture formats (uncompressed, single plane).
member.param: The array or depth slice index (zero-based).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.GetPixels(FlaxEngine.Color[]@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the texture pixels as Color array.
member.remarks: Supported only for 'basic' texture formats (uncompressed, single plane).
member.param: The array or depth slice index (zero-based).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.SetPixels(FlaxEngine.Color32[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the texture pixels as Color32 array (asset must be virtual and already initialized).
member.remarks: Supported only for 'basic' texture formats (uncompressed, single plane).
member.param: The array or depth slice index (zero-based).
Enables automatic mip-maps generation (fast point filter) based on the current mip (will generate lower mips).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.SetPixels(FlaxEngine.Color[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the texture pixels as Color array (asset must be virtual and already initialized).
member.remarks: Supported only for 'basic' texture formats (uncompressed, single plane).
member.param: The array or depth slice index (zero-based).
Enables automatic mip-maps generation (fast point filter) based on the current mip (will generate lower mips).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.Init(FlaxEngine.TextureBase.InitData@)
member.summary: Initializes the texture storage container with the given data. Valid only for virtual assets. Can be used in both Editor and at runtime in a build game. It does not perform any data streaming or uploading to the GPU. Only the texture resource is being initialized and the data is copied to be streamed later.
member.remarks: Can be used only for virtual assets (see and ).

member.summary: Represents a single hardware gamepad device. Used by the Input to report raw gamepad input events.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Gamepad.ProductID
member.summary: Gets the gamepad device type identifier.

member.summary: Checks if any gamepad button is currently pressed.

member.summary: Gets the gamepad axis value.
member.returns: Axis value.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Gamepad.GetButton(FlaxEngine.GamepadButton)
member.summary: Gets the gamepad button state (true if being pressed during the current frame).
member.returns: True if user holds down the button, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Gamepad.GetButtonDown(FlaxEngine.GamepadButton)
member.summary: Gets the gamepad button down state (true if was pressed during the current frame).
member.returns: True if user starts pressing down the button, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Gamepad.GetButtonUp(FlaxEngine.GamepadButton)
member.summary: Gets the gamepad button up state (true if was released during the current frame).
member.returns: True if user releases the button, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Gamepad.SetVibration(FlaxEngine.GamepadVibrationState)
member.summary: Sets the state of the gamepad vibration. Ignored if controller does not support this.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Gamepad.SetColor(FlaxEngine.Color)
member.summary: Sets the color of the gamepad light. Ignored if controller does not support this.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Gamepad.ResetColor
member.summary: Resets the color of the gamepad light to the default. Ignored if controller does not support this.

member.summary: Event fired when touch action ends.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Input.Gamepads
member.summary: Gets the gamepads.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionMappings
member.summary: Maps a discrete button or key press events to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to event-driven behavior. The end effect is that pressing (and/or releasing) a key, mouse button, or keypad button.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisMappings
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Input.GamepadsCount
member.summary: Gets the gamepads count.

member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse position in screen-space coordinates.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Input.GetAction(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the virtual action identified by name. Use to get the current config.
member.returns: True if action has been triggered in the current frame (e.g. button pressed), otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Input.GetActionState(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the virtual action identified by name. Use to get the current config.
member.returns: A InputActionPhase determining the current phase of the Action (e.g If it was just pressed, is being held or just released).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Input.GetAxis(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the virtual axis identified by name. Use to get the current config.
member.returns: The current axis value (e.g for gamepads it's in the range -1..1). Value is smoothed to reduce artifacts.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Input.GetAxisRaw(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the raw value of the virtual axis identified by name with no smoothing filtering applied. Use to get the current config.
member.returns: The current axis value (e.g for gamepads it's in the range -1..1). No smoothing applied.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ActionConfig
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.

member.summary: The axis "friendly name" used to access it from code.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Gamepad
member.summary: Which gamepad should be used.

member.summary: The button to be pressed for movement in positive direction. Use to ignore it.

member.summary: The button to be pressed for movement in negative direction. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.GamepadNegativeButton
member.summary: The button to be pressed for movement in negative direction. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.DeadZone
member.summary: Any positive or negative values that are less than this number will register as zero. Useful for gamepads to specify the deadzone.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Sensitivity
member.summary: For keyboard input, a larger value will result in faster response time (in units/s). A lower value will be more smooth. For Mouse delta the value will scale the actual mouse delta.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Gravity
member.summary: For keyboard input describes how fast will the input recenter. Speed (in units/s) that output value will rest to neutral value if not when device at rest.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Scale
member.summary: Additional scale parameter applied to the axis value. Allows to invert it or modify the range.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Snap
member.summary: If enabled, the axis value will be immediately reset to zero after it receives opposite inputs. For keyboard input only.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AxisConfig.Default
member.summary: The default .

Rotates the actor around axis passing through point in world-space by angle (in degrees).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel
member.summary: Performs an animation and renders a skinned model.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationUpdated
member.summary: Called after animation gets updated (new skeleton pose).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.SkinnedModel
member.summary: The skinned model asset used for rendering.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationGraph
member.summary: The animation graph asset used for the skinned mesh skeleton bones evaluation (controls the animation).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.PerBoneMotionBlur
member.summary: If true, use per-bone motion blur on this skeletal model. It requires additional rendering, can be disabled to save performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UseTimeScale
member.summary: If true, animation speed will be affected by the global time scale parameter.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UpdateWhenOffscreen
member.summary: If true, the animation will be updated even when an actor cannot be seen by any camera. Otherwise, the animations themselves will also stop running when the actor is off-screen.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UpdateSpeed
member.summary: The animation update delta time scale. Can be used to speed up animation playback or create slow motion effect.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UpdateMode
member.summary: The animation update mode. Can be used to optimize the performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.BoundsScale
member.summary: The master scale parameter for the actor bounding box. Helps reducing mesh flickering effect on screen edges.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.CustomBounds
member.summary: The custom bounds(in actor local space). If set to empty bounds then source skinned model bind pose bounds will be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.LODBias
member.summary: The model Level Of Detail bias value. Allows to increase or decrease rendered model quality.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.ForcedLOD
member.summary: Gets the model forced Level Of Detail index. Allows to bind the given model LOD to show. Value -1 disables this feature.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.DrawModes
member.summary: The draw passes to use for rendering this object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.SortOrder
member.summary: The object sort order key used when sorting drawable objects during rendering. Use lower values to draw object before others, higher values are rendered later (on top). Can be used to control transparency drawing.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.ShadowsMode
member.summary: The shadows casting mode. [Deprecated on 26.10.2022, expires on 26.10.2024]

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.RootMotionTarget
member.summary: The animation root motion apply target. If not specified the animated model will apply it itself.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.EnableTracing
member.summary: Enables extracting animation playback insights for debugging or custom scripting.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog
member.summary: Used to create fogging effects such as clouds but with a density that is related to the height of the fog.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogDensity
member.summary: The fog density factor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogHeightFalloff
member.summary: The fog height density factor that controls how the density increases as height decreases. Smaller values produce a more visible transition layer.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogInscatteringColor
member.summary: Color of the fog.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogMaxOpacity
member.summary: Maximum opacity of the fog. A value of 1 means the fog can become fully opaque at a distance and replace scene color completely. A value of 0 means the fog color will not be factored in at all.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.StartDistance
member.summary: Distance from the camera that the fog will start, in world units.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogCutoffDistance
member.summary: Scene elements past this distance will not have fog applied. This is useful for excluding skyboxes which already have fog baked in. Setting this value to 0 disables it.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringLight
member.summary: Directional light used for Directional Inscattering.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringExponent
member.summary: Controls the size of the directional inscattering cone, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used. Range: 2-64.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringStartDistance
member.summary: Controls the start distance from the viewer of the directional inscattering, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringColor
member.summary: Controls the color of the directional inscattering, which is used to approximate inscattering from a directional light. Note: there must be a directional light enabled for DirectionalInscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogEnable
member.summary: Whether to enable Volumetric fog. Graphics quality settings control the resolution of the fog simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogScatteringDistribution
member.summary: Controls the scattering phase function - how much incoming light scatters in various directions. A distribution value of 0 scatters equally in all directions, while 0.9 scatters predominantly in the light direction. In order to have visible volumetric fog light shafts from the side, the distribution will need to be closer to 0. Range: -0.9-0.9.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogAlbedo
member.summary: The height fog particle reflectiveness used by volumetric fog. Water particles in air have an albedo near white, while dust has slightly darker value.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogEmissive
member.summary: Light emitted by height fog. This is a density value so more light is emitted the further you are looking through the fog. In most cases using a Skylight is a better choice, however, it may be useful in certain scenarios.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogExtinctionScale
member.summary: Scales the height fog particle extinction amount used by volumetric fog. Values larger than 1 cause fog particles everywhere absorb more light. Range: 0.1-10.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogDistance
member.summary: Distance over which volumetric fog should be computed. Larger values extend the effect into the distance but expose under-sampling artifacts in details.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Light
member.summary: Base class for all light types.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Light.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.Color
member.summary: Color of the light

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.Brightness
member.summary: Brightness of the light

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.ViewDistance
member.summary: Controls light visibility range. The distance at which the light becomes completely faded (blend happens on the last 10% of that range). Use a value of 0 to always draw light.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.IndirectLightingIntensity
member.summary: Controls how much this light will contribute indirect lighting. When set to 0, there is no GI from the light. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.VolumetricScatteringIntensity
member.summary: Controls how much this light will contribute to the Volumetric Fog. When set to 0, there is no contribution.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Light.CastVolumetricShadow
member.summary: Toggles whether or not to cast a volumetric shadow for lights contributing to Volumetric Fog. Also shadows casting by this light should be enabled in order to make it cast volumetric fog shadow.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow
member.summary: Base class for all light types that can cast dynamic or static shadow. Contains more shared properties for point/spot/directional lights.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.MinRoughness
member.summary: The minimum roughness value used to clamp material surface roughness during shading pixel.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsDistance
member.summary: Shadows casting distance from view.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsFadeDistance
member.summary: Shadows fade off distance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsSharpness
member.summary: TheShadows edges sharpness.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsStrength
member.summary: Dynamic shadows blending strength. Default is 1 for fully opaque shadows, value 0 disables shadows.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsDepthBias
member.summary: The depth bias used for shadow map comparison.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsNormalOffsetScale
member.summary: A factor specifying the offset to add to the calculated shadow map depth with respect to the surface normal.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ContactShadowsLength
member.summary: The length of the rays for contact shadows computed via the screen-space tracing. Set this to values higher than 0 to enable screen-space shadows rendering for this light. This improves the shadowing details. Actual ray distance is based on the pixel distance from the camera.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsUpdateRate
member.summary: Frequency of shadow updates. 1 - every frame, 0.5 - every second frame, 0 - on start or change. It's the inverse value of how many frames should happen in-between shadow map updates (eg. inverse of 0.5 is 2 thus shadow will update every 2nd frame).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsUpdateRateAtDistance
member.summary: Frequency of shadow updates at the maximum distance from the view at which shadows are still rendered. This value is multiplied by ShadowsUpdateRate and allows scaling the update rate in-between the shadow range. For example, if light is near view, it will get normal shadow updates but will reduce this rate when far from view. See ShadowsUpdateRate to learn more.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsResolution
member.summary: Defines the resolution of the shadow map texture used to draw objects projection from light-point-of-view. Higher values increase shadow quality at cost of performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.ShadowsMode
member.summary: Describes how a visual element casts shadows.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LightWithShadow.InvalidateShadow

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Gets or sets the model entries collection. Each entry contains data how to render meshes using this entry (transformation, material, shadows casting, etc.).

member.summary: Gets the material slots array set on the asset (eg. model or skinned model asset).

member.summary: Gets the material used to draw the meshes which are assigned to that slot (set in Entries or model's default).

member.summary: Sets the material to the entry slot. Can be used to override the material of the meshes using this slot.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ModelInstanceActor.CreateAndSetVirtualMaterialInstance(System.Int32)
member.summary: Utility to crate a new virtual Material Instance asset, set its parent to the currently applied material, and assign it to the entry. Can be used to modify the material parameters from code.
member.returns: The created virtual material instance.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ModelInstanceActor.IntersectsEntry(System.Int32,FlaxEngine.Ray@,System.Single@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Determines if there is an intersection between the model actor mesh entry and a ray. If mesh data is available on the CPU performs exact intersection check with the geometry. Otherwise performs simple vs test. For more efficient collisions detection and ray casting use physics.
member.param: The material slot entry index to test.
When the method completes and returns true, contains the distance of the intersection (if any valid).
When the method completes, contains the intersection surface normal vector (if any valid).
member.returns: True if the actor is intersected by the ray, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ModelInstanceActor.IntersectsEntry(FlaxEngine.Ray@,System.Single@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Determines if there is an intersection between the model actor mesh entry and a ray. If mesh data is available on the CPU performs exact intersection check with the geometry. Otherwise performs simple vs test. For more efficient collisions detection and ray casting use physics.
member.param: When the method completes and returns true, contains the distance of the intersection (if any valid).
When the method completes, contains the intersection surface normal vector (if any valid).
When the method completes, contains the intersection entry index (if any valid).
member.returns: True if the actor is intersected by the ray, otherwise false.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll
member.summary: Actor that synchronizes Animated Model skeleton pose with physical bones bodies simulated with physics. Child rigidbodies are used for per-bone simulation - rigidbodies names must match skeleton bone name and should be ordered based on importance in the skeleton tree (parents first).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.BonesWeight
member.summary: The default bones weight where 0 means fully animated bone and 1 means fully simulate bones. Can be used to control all bones simulation mode but is overriden by per-bone BonesWeights.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.BonesWeights
member.summary: The per-bone weights for ragdoll simulation. Key is bone name, value is the blend weight where 0 means fully animated bone and 1 means fully simulated bone. Can be used to control per-bone simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.PositionSolverIterations
member.summary: The minimum number of position iterations the physics solver should perform for bodies in this ragdoll. Higher values improve stability but affect performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.VelocitySolverIterations
member.summary: The minimum number of velocity iterations the physics solver should perform for bodies in this ragdoll. Higher values improve stability but affect performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.MaxDepenetrationVelocity
member.summary: The maximum depenetration velocity when ragdoll's rigidbody moving out of penetrating state. Using this property can smooth objects moving out of colliding state and prevent unstable motion.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.TotalMass
member.summary: Calculates the total mass of all ragdoll bodies.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.SetLinearVelocity(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the linear velocity of all rigidbodies in the ragdoll.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Ragdoll.SetAngularVelocity(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the angular velocity of all rigidbodies in the ragdoll (in radians per second).

member.summary: Gets or sets the spline model quality scale. Higher values improve the spline representation (better tessellation) but reduce performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SplineModel.BoundsScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the model bounds scale. It is useful when using Position Offset to animate the vertices of the object outside of its bounds.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SplineModel.LODBias
member.summary: Gets or sets the model Level Of Detail bias value. Allows to increase or decrease rendered model quality.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.SplineModel.ForcedLOD
member.summary: Gets or sets the model forced Level Of Detail index. Allows to bind the given model LOD to show. Value -1 disables this feature.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.LargeWorlds
member.summary: The engine utility for large worlds support. Contains constants and tools for using 64-bit precision coordinates in various game systems (eg. scene rendering).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LargeWorlds.Enable
member.summary: Enables large worlds usage in the engine. If true, scene rendering and other systems will use origin shifting to achieve higher precision in large worlds.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LargeWorlds.ChunkSize
member.summary: Defines the size of a single chunk. Large world (64-bit) gets divided into smaller chunks so all the math operations (32-bit) can be performed relative to the chunk origin without precision loss.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LargeWorlds.UpdateOrigin(FlaxEngine.Vector3@,FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Updates the large world origin to match the input position. The origin is snapped to the best matching chunk location.
member.param: The current origin of the large world. Gets updated with the input position.
The current input position (eg. render view location or auto listener position).
member.remarks: Used only if LargeWorlds.Enabled is true.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Prefab
member.summary: Json asset that stores the collection of scene objects including actors and scripts. In general it can serve as any grouping of scene objects (for example a level) or be used as a form of a template instantiated and reused throughout the scene.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Requests the default prefab object instance. Deserializes the prefab objects from the asset. Skips if already done.
member.returns: The root of the prefab object loaded from the prefab. Contains the default values. It's not added to gameplay but deserialized with postLoad and init event fired.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Prefab.GetDefaultInstance(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Requests the default prefab object instance. Deserializes the prefab objects from the asset. Skips if already done.
member.param: The ID of the object to get from prefab default object. It can be one of the child-actors or any script that exists in the prefab. Methods returns root if id is empty.
member.returns: The object of the prefab loaded from the prefab. Contains the default values. It's not added to gameplay but deserialized with postLoad and init event fired.

member.summary: The scene asset typename. Type of the serialized scene asset data. Hidden class for the scene assets. member.summary: Checks if the list of tags contains any of the given tags (including parent tags check). For example, HasAny({"A.B", "C"}, {"A"}) returns true, for exact check use HasAnyExact.
member.returns: True if any of of the given tags is contained by the list of tags.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Tags.HasAnyExact(FlaxEngine.Tag[],FlaxEngine.Tag[])
member.summary: Checks if the list of tags contains any of the given tags (exact match). For example, HasAnyExact({"A.B", "C"}, {"A"}) returns false, for parents check use HasAny.
member.returns: True if any of the given tags is contained by the list of tags.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Tags.HasAll(FlaxEngine.Tag[],FlaxEngine.Tag[])
member.summary: Checks if the list of tags contains all the given tags (including parent tags check). For example, HasAll({"A.B", "C"}, {"A", "C"}) returns true, for exact check use HasAllExact.
member.returns: True if all the given tags are contained by the list of tags. Returns true for empty list.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Tags.HasAllExact(FlaxEngine.Tag[],FlaxEngine.Tag[])
member.summary: Checks if the list of tags contains all the given tags (exact match). For example, HasAllExact({"A.B", "C"}, {"A", "C"}) returns false, for parents check use HasAll.
member.returns: True if all the given tags are contained by the list of tags. Returns true for empty list.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.BuildNavMesh(FlaxEngine.Scene,System.Single)
member.summary: Builds the Nav Mesh for the given scene (discards all its tiles).
member.remarks: Requests are enqueued till the next game scripts update. Actual navmesh building in done via Thread Pool tasks in a background to prevent game thread stalls.
member.param: The timeout to wait before building Nav Mesh (in milliseconds).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Navigation.BuildNavMesh(FlaxEngine.Scene,FlaxEngine.BoundingBox,System.Single)
member.summary: Builds the Nav Mesh for the given scene (builds only the tiles overlapping the given bounding box).
member.remarks: Requests are enqueued till the next game scripts update. Actual navmesh building in done via Thread Pool tasks in a background to prevent game thread stalls.
member.param: The bounds in world-space to build overlapping tiles.
The timeout to wait before building Nav Mesh (in milliseconds).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties
member.summary: The navigation system agent properties container for navmesh building and querying.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.Radius
member.summary: The radius of the agent used for navigation. Agents can't pass through gaps of less than twice the radius.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.Height
member.summary: The height of the agent used for navigation. Agents can't enter areas with ceilings lower than this value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.StepHeight
member.summary: The step height used for navigation. Defines the maximum ledge height that is considered to still be traversable by the agent.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.MaxSlopeAngle
member.summary: The maximum slope (in degrees) that is considered walkable for navigation. Agents can't go up or down slopes higher than this value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.MaxSpeed
member.summary: The maximum movement speed (units/s).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.CrowdSeparationWeight
member.summary: The crowd agent separation weight that defines how aggressive the agent manager should be at avoiding collisions with this agent.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavAgentProperties.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties
member.summary: The navigation mesh properties container for navmesh building.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Name
member.summary: The navmesh type name. Identifies different types of the navmeshes, used to sync navmesh properties with settings asset.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Color
member.summary: The navmesh type color (for debugging).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Rotation
member.summary: The navmesh rotation applied to navigation surface. Used during building to the rotate scene geometry and to revert back result during path finding queries. Can be used to generate navmesh on walls.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Agent
member.summary: The properties of the agent used to generate walkable navigation surface.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.DefaultQueryExtent
member.summary: The default extents for the nav queries that defines the search distance along each axis (x, y, z). Smaller values prevent queries from snapping to too far locations.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavMeshProperties.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.summary: The agents selection mask.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavAgentMask.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.summary: The result information for navigation mesh queries.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties
member.summary: The navigation area properties container for navmesh building and navigation runtime.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Name
member.summary: The area type name. Identifies different types of the areas.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Color
member.summary: The area type color (for debugging). Alpha channel is used to blend with navmesh color (alpha 0 to use navmesh color only).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Id
member.summary: The area id. It must be unique for the project. Valid range 0-63. Value 0 is reserved for Null areas (empty, non-navigable areas).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Cost
member.summary: The cost scale for the area traversal for agents. The higher the cost, the less likely agent wil choose the path that goes over it. For instance, areas that are harder to move like sand should have higher cost for proper path finding.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavAreaProperties.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavLink
member.summary: The off-mesh link objects used to define a custom point-to-point edge within the navigation graph. An off-mesh connection is a user defined traversable connection made up to two vertices, at least one of which resides within a navigation mesh polygon allowing movement outside the navigation mesh.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.NavLink.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavLink.Start
member.summary: The start location which transform is representing link start position. It is defined in local-space of the actor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavLink.End
member.summary: The end location which transform is representing link end position. It is defined in local-space of the actor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavLink.Radius
member.summary: The maximum radius of the agents that can go through the link.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.NavLink.BiDirectional
member.summary: Flag used to define links that can be traversed in both directions. When set to false the link can only be traversed from start to end.

member.summary: Reliable-ordered channel type. Messages won't be lost and always arrive in order.

member.summary: The network driver instance (implements INetworkDriver) that will be used to create and manage the peer, send and receive messages.
member.remarks: Object is managed by the created network peer (will be deleted on peer shutdown).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.ConnectionsLimit
member.summary: The upper limit on how many peers can join when we're listening.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.Address
member.summary: Address used to connect to or listen at.
member.remarks: Set it to "any" when you want to listen at all available addresses.
Only IPv4 is supported.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.Port
member.summary: The port to connect to or listen at.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.MessageSize
member.summary: The size of a message buffer in bytes. Should be lower than the MTU (maximal transmission unit) - typically 1500 bytes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig.MessagePoolSize
member.summary: The amount of pooled messages that can be used at once (receiving and sending!).
member.remarks: Creating more messages than this limit will result in a crash! This should be tweaked manually to fit the needs (adjusting this value will increase/decrease memory usage)!

member.summary: Invalid network event type.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Connected
member.summary: Event "connected" - client connected to our server or we've connected to the server.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Disconnected
member.summary: Event "disconnected" - client disconnected from our server or we've been kicked from the server.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Timeout
member.summary: Event "disconnected" - client got a timeout from our server or we've list the connection to the server.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEventType.Message
member.summary: Event "message" - message received from some client or the server.

member.summary: The type of the received event.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEvent.Message
member.summary: The message when this event is an "message" event - not valid in any other cases. If this is an message-event, make sure to return the message using RecycleMessage function of the peer after processing it!

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEvent.Sender
member.summary: The connected of the client that has sent message, connected, disconnected or got a timeout.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkEvent.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.summary: The delegate for event ClientConnecting.

member.summary: Event called after new client successfully disconnected.

member.summary: The target amount of the network logic updates per second (frequency of replication, events sending and network ticking). Use 0 to run every game update.

member.summary: Current manager mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkManager.State
member.summary: Current network connection state.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkManager.Frame
member.summary: Current network system frame number (incremented every tick). Can be used for frames counting in networking and replication.

member.returns: The acquired message.
member.remarks: Make sure to recycle the message to this peer once it is no longer needed!

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.RecycleMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage)
member.summary: Returns given message to the pool.
member.remarks: Make sure that this message belongs to the peer and has not been recycled already (debug build checks for this)!

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.BeginSendMessage
member.summary: Acquires new message from the pool and setups it for sending.
member.returns: The acquired message.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.AbortSendMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage)
member.summary: Aborts given message send. This effectively deinitializes the message and returns it to the pool.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.EndSendMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage)
member.summary: Sends given message over specified channel to the server.
member.param: The channel to send the message over.
member.remarks: Can be used only by the client!
Do not recycle the message after calling this. This function automatically recycles the message.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.EndSendMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConnection)
member.summary: Sends given message over specified channel to the given client connection (target).
member.param: The channel to send the message over.
The client connection to send the message to.
member.remarks: Can be used only by the server!
Do not recycle the message after calling this. This function automatically recycles the message.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.EndSendMessage(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkChannelType,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkMessage,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConnection[])
member.summary: Sends given message over specified channel to the given client connection (target).
member.param: The channel to send the message over.
The connections list to send the message to.
member.remarks: Can be used only by the server!
Do not recycle the message after calling this. This function automatically recycles the message.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.CreatePeer(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkConfig)
member.summary: Creates new peer using given configuration.
member.param: The configuration to create and setup new peer.
member.returns: The peer.
member.remarks: Peer should be destroyed using once it is no longer in use. Returns null if failed to create a peer (eg. config is invalid).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer.ShutdownPeer(FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkPeer)
member.summary: Shutdowns and destroys given peer.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchyObject
member.summary: Network replication hierarchy object data.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchyObject.Object
member.summary: The object to replicate.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchyObject.ReplicationFPS
member.summary: The target amount of the replication updates per second (frequency of the replication). Constrained by NetworkManager.NetworkFPS. Use 0 for 'always relevant' object and less than 0 (eg. -1) for 'never relevant' objects that would only get synced on client join once (or upon DirtyObject).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchyObject.CullDistance
member.summary: The minimum distance from the player to the object at which it can process replication. For example, players further away won't receive object data. Use 0 if unused.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchyObject.ReplicationUpdatesLeft
member.summary: Runtime value for update frames left for the next replication of this object. Matches NetworkManager.NetworkFPS calculated from ReplicationFPS. Set to 1 if ReplicationFPS less than 0 to indicate dirty object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchyObject.Actor
member.summary: Gets the actors context (object itself or parent actor).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkClientsMask
member.summary: Bit mask for NetworkClient list (eg. to selectively send object replication).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkClientsMask.Word0
member.summary: The first 64 bits (each for one client).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkClientsMask.Word1
member.summary: The second 64 bits (each for one client).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkClientsMask.All
member.summary: All bits set for all clients.

member.summary: Network replication hierarchy output data to send.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchyUpdateResult.ReplicationScale
member.summary: Scales the ReplicationFPS property of objects in hierarchy. Can be used to slow down or speed up replication rate.

member.summary: Gets amount of the clients to use. Matches NetworkManager.Clients.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchyUpdateResult.ClientsMask
member.summary: Gets mask with all client bits set. Matches NetworkManager.Clients.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicationHierarchy
member.summary: Defines the network objects replication hierarchy (tree structure) that controls chunking and configuration of the game objects replication. Contains only 'owned' objects. It's used by the networking system only on a main thread.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkObjectRole
member.summary: The high-level network object role and authority. Used to define who owns the object and when it can be simulated or just replicated.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkObjectRole.None
member.summary: Not replicated object.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkObjectRole.OwnedAuthoritative
member.summary: Server/client owns the object and replicates it to others. Only owning client can simulate object and provides current state.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkObjectRole.Replicated
member.summary: Server/client gets replicated object from other server/client who owns it. Object cannot be simulated locally (any changes will be overriden by replication).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkObjectRole.ReplicatedSimulated
member.summary: Client gets replicated object from server but still can locally autonomously simulate it too. For example, client can control local pawn with real human input but will validate with server proper state (eg. to prevent cheats).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator
member.summary: High-level networking replication system for game objects.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.EnableLog
member.summary: Enables verbose logging of the networking runtime. Can be used to debug problems of missing RPC invoke or object replication issues.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.Hierarchy
member.summary: Gets or sets the network replication hierarchy.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.AddObject(FlaxEngine.Object,FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Adds the object to the network replication system.
member.remarks: Does nothing if network is offline.
member.param: The parent of the object (eg. player that spawned it).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.RemoveObject(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Removes the object from the network replication system.
member.remarks: Does nothing if network is offline.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.SpawnObject(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Spawns the object to the other clients. Can be spawned by the owner who locally created it (eg. from prefab).
member.remarks: Does nothing if network is offline. Doesn't spawn actor in a level - but in network replication system.
member.param: The object to spawn on other clients.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.SpawnObject(FlaxEngine.Object,System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Spawns the object to the other clients. Can be spawned by the owner who locally created it (eg. from prefab).
member.remarks: Does nothing if network is offline. Doesn't spawn actor in a level - but in network replication system.
member.param: The object to spawn on other clients.
List with network client IDs that should receive network spawn event. Empty to spawn on all clients.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.DespawnObject(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Despawns the object from the other clients. Deletes object from remove clients.
member.remarks: Does nothing if network is offline.
member.param: The object to despawn on other clients.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.HasObject(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the network object is spawned or added to the network replication system.
member.returns: True if object exists in networking, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.MapObjectId(System.Guid@)
member.summary: Maps object ID into server or client ID (depending on the source ID). Leaves source value unchanged if that specific ID is unused.
member.param: The network object identifier to map. Contains result ID once the method completes.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.ResolveForeignObject(System.Guid)
member.summary: Resolves foreign Guid into a local ScriptingObject
member.param: The Guid of a foreign object.
member.returns: Object if managed to resolve, otherwise null.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.GetObjectOwnerClientId(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Gets the Client Id of the network object owner.
member.returns: The Client Id.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.GetObjectRole(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Gets the role of the network object used locally (eg. to check if can simulate object).
member.returns: The object role.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.IsObjectOwned(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the network object is owned locally (thus current client has authority to manage it).
member.remarks: Equivalent to GetObjectRole == OwnedAuthoritative.
member.returns: True if object is owned by this client, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.IsObjectSimulated(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the network object is simulated locally (thus current client has can modify it - changed might be overriden by other client who owns this object).
member.remarks: Equivalent to GetObjectRole != Replicated.
member.returns: True if object is simulated on this client, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.IsObjectReplicated(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Checks if the network object is replicated locally (any local changes might be overriden by other client who owns this object).
member.remarks: Equivalent to (GetObjectRole == Replicated or GetObjectRole == ReplicatedAutonomous).
member.returns: True if object is simulated on this client, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.SetObjectOwnership(FlaxEngine.Object,System.UInt32,FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkObjectRole,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the network object ownership - owning client identifier and local role to use.
member.param: The new owner. Set to NetworkManager.LocalClientId for local client to be owner (server might reject it).
The local role to assign for the object.
True if apply the ownership to all child objects of this object (eg. all child actors and scripts attached to the networked actor).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Networking.NetworkReplicator.DirtyObject(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Marks the object dirty to perform immediate replication to the other clients.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect
member.summary: The particle system instance that plays the particles simulation in the game.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.ParticleSystem
member.summary: The particle system to play.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.CustomViewRenderTask
member.summary: The custom render task used as a view information source (effect will use its render buffers and rendering resolution information for particles simulation).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.UpdateMode
member.summary: The particles simulation update mode. Defines how to update particles emitter.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.FixedTimestep
member.summary: The fixed timestep for simulation updates. Used only if UpdateMode is set to FixedTimestep.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.SimulationSpeed
member.summary: The particles simulation speed factor. Scales the particle system update delta time. Can be used to speed up or slow down the particles.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.UseTimeScale
member.summary: Determines whether the particle effect should take into account the global game time scale for simulation updates.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.IsLooping
member.summary: Determines whether the particle effect should loop when it finishes playing.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.PlayOnStart
member.summary: Determines whether the particle effect should play on start.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.UpdateWhenOffscreen
member.summary: If true, the particle simulation will be updated even when an actor cannot be seen by any camera. Otherwise, the simulation will stop running when the actor is off-screen.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.DrawModes
member.summary: The draw passes to use for rendering this object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.SortOrder
member.summary: The object sort order key used when sorting drawable objects during rendering. Use lower values to draw object before others, higher values are rendered later (on top). Can be used to control transparency drawing.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.Parameters
member.summary: Gets the effect parameters collection. Those parameters are instanced from the that contains a linear list of emitters and every emitter has a list of own parameters.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.ParametersVersion
member.summary: Gets the effect parameters collection version number. It can be used to track parameters changes that occur when particle system or one of the emitters gets reloaded/edited.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets the current time position of the particle system timeline animation playback (in seconds).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.LastUpdateTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the last game time when particle system was updated. Value -1 indicates no previous updates.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.ParticlesCount
member.summary: Gets the particles count (total). GPU particles count is read with one frame delay (due to GPU execution).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.IsPlaying
member.summary: Gets whether or not the particle effect is playing.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.GetParameter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the particle parameter.
member.param: The emitter track name (in particle system asset).
The emitter parameter name (in particle emitter asset).
member.returns: The effect parameter or null if failed to find.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.GetParameter(System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the particle parameter.
member.param: The emitter track name (in particle system asset).
The emitter parameter ID (in particle emitter asset).
member.returns: The effect parameter or null if failed to find.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.GetParameterValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the particle parameter value.
member.param: The emitter track name (in particle system asset).

member.summary: Set the particle parameter value.

member.summary: Resets the particle system parameters to the default values from asset.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.ResetSimulation
member.summary: Resets the particles simulation state (clears the instance state data but preserves the instance parameters values).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.UpdateSimulation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs the full particles simulation update (postponed for the next particle manager update).
member.param: True if update animation by a single frame only (time time since last engine update), otherwise will update simulation with delta time since last update.

member.summary: Manually spawns additional particles into the simulation.
member.param: Name of the emitter track to spawn particles in. Empty if spawn particles into all tracks.

member.summary: Plays the simulation.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the simulation.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.Stop
member.summary: Stops and resets the simulation.

member.summary: The particles simulation update modes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.SimulationUpdateMode.Realtime
member.summary: Use realtime simulation updates. Updates particles during every game logic update.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.SimulationUpdateMode.FixedTimestep
member.summary: Use fixed timestep delta time to update particles simulation with a custom frequency.

member.summary: Sorts particles by depth to the view's near plane.

member.summary: Sorts particles by distance to the view's origin.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Cloth
member.summary: Physical simulation actor for cloth objects made of vertices that are simulated as cloth particles with physical properties, forces, and constraints to affect cloth behavior.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Cloth.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.Mesh
member.summary: Gets or sets the mesh to use for the cloth simulation (single mesh from specific LOD). Always from the parent static or animated model actor.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.Force
member.summary: Gets or sets the cloth response to forces settings.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.Collision
member.summary: Gets or sets the cloth response to collisions settings.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.Simulation
member.summary: Gets or sets the cloth simulation settings.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.Fabric
member.summary: Gets or sets the cloth's fabric settings (material's stiffness and compression response).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Cloth.Rebuild
member.summary: Recreates the cloth by removing current instance data and creating a new physical cloth object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ClearInteria
member.summary: Sets the inertia derived from transform change to zero (once). It will reset any cloth object movement effects as it was teleported.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Cloth.GetParticles
member.summary: Gets the cloth particles data with per-particle XYZ position (in local cloth-space).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SetParticles(FlaxEngine.Float3[])
member.summary: Sets the cloth particles data with per-particle XYZ position (in local cloth-space). The size of the input data had to match the cloth size.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Cloth.GetPaint
member.summary: Gets the cloth particles paint data with per-particle max distance (normalized 0-1, 0 makes particle immovable). Returned value is empty if cloth was not initialized or doesn't use paint feature.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SetPaint(System.Single[])
member.summary: Sets the cloth particles paint data with per-particle max distance (normalized 0-1, 0 makes particle immovable). The size of the input data had to match the cloth size. Set to empty to remove paint.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings
member.summary: Cloth response to forces settings.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.GravityScale
member.summary: Scale multiplier applied to the gravity of cloth particles (scales the global gravity force).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.Damping
member.summary: Damping of cloth particle velocity. 0: velocity is unaffected. 1: velocity is zeroed.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.LinearDrag
member.summary: Portion of velocity applied to cloth particles. 0: cloth particles are unaffected. 1: damped global cloth particle velocity.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.AngularDrag
member.summary: Portion of angular velocity applied to turning cloth particles. 0: cloth particles are unaffected. 1: damped global cloth particle angular velocity.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.LinearInertia
member.summary: Portion of linear acceleration applied to cloth particles. 0: cloth particles are unaffected. 1: physically correct linear acceleration.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.AngularInertia
member.summary: Portion of angular acceleration applied to turning cloth particles. 0: cloth particles are unaffected. 1: physically correct angular acceleration.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.CentrifugalInertia
member.summary: Portion of angular velocity applied to turning cloth particles. 0: cloth particles are unaffected. 1: physically correct angular velocity.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.AirDragCoefficient
member.summary: Defines how much drag air applies to the cloth particles. Set to 0 to disable wind.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.AirLiftCoefficient
member.summary: Defines how much lift air applies to the cloth particles. Set to 0 to disable wind.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.AirDensity
member.summary: Defines fluid density of air used for drag and lift calculations.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.ForceSettings.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings
member.summary: Cloth response to collisions settings.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings.Friction
member.summary: Controls the amount of friction between cloth particles and colliders. 0: friction disabled.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings.MassScale
member.summary: Controls how quickly cloth particle mass is increased during collisions. 0: mass scale disabled.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings.SceneCollisions
member.summary: Enables collisions with scene geometry (both dynamic and static). Disable this to improve performance of cloth that doesn't need to collide.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings.ContinuousCollisionDetection
member.summary: Enables Continuous Collision Detection (CCD) that improves collision by computing the time of impact between cloth particles and colliders. The increase in quality can impact performance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings.CollisionThickness
member.summary: Additional thickness of the simulated cloth to prevent intersections with nearby colliders.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings.SelfCollisionDistance
member.summary: The minimum distance that the colliding cloth particles must maintain from each other in meters. 0: self collision disabled.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings.SelfCollisionStiffness
member.summary: Stiffness for the self collision constraints. 0: self collision disabled.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.CollisionSettings.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SimulationSettings
member.summary: Cloth simulation settings.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SimulationSettings.SolverFrequency
member.summary: Target cloth solver iterations per second. The executed number of iterations per second may vary dependent on many performance factors. However, at least one iteration per frame is solved regardless of the value set.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SimulationSettings.CullDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance from the camera at which to run cloth simulation. Used to improve performance and skip updating too far clothes. The physics system might reduce the update rate for clothes far enough (eg. half this distance). 0 to disable any culling.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SimulationSettings.UpdateWhenOffscreen
member.summary: If true, the cloth will be updated even when an actor cannot be seen by any camera. Otherwise, the cloth simulation will stop running when the actor is off-screen.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SimulationSettings.MaxParticleDistance
member.summary: The maximum distance cloth particles can move from the original location (within local-space of the actor). Scaled by painted per-particle value (0-1) to restrict movement of certain particles.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SimulationSettings.ComputeNormals
member.summary: Enables automatic normal vectors computing for the cloth mesh, otherwise original mesh normals will be used.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SimulationSettings.WindVelocity
member.summary: Wind velocity vector (direction and magnitude) in world coordinates. A greater magnitude applies a stronger wind force. Ensure that Air Drag and Air Lift coefficients are non-zero in order to apply wind force.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.SimulationSettings.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Cloth.FabricAxisSettings
member.summary: Cloth's fabric settings (material's stiffness and compression response) for a single axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.FabricAxisSettings.Stiffness
member.summary: Stiffness value for stretch and compression constraints. 0: disables it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.FabricAxisSettings.StiffnessMultiplier
member.summary: Scale value for stretch and compression constraints. 0: no stretch and compression constraints applied. 1: fully apply stretch and compression constraints.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.FabricAxisSettings.CompressionLimit
member.summary: Compression limit for constraints.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Cloth.FabricAxisSettings.StretchLimit
member.summary: Stretch limit for constraints.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Cloth.FabricAxisSettings.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Cloth.FabricSettings
member.summary: Cloth's fabric settings (material's stiffness and compression response).

member.summary: Vertical constraints for stretching or compression (along the gravity).

member.summary: Horizontal constraints for stretching or compression (perpendicular to the gravity).
