member.summary: Bending constraints for out-of-plane bending in angle-based formulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.IsKinematic
member.summary: Enables kinematic mode for the rigidbody. Kinematic rigidbodies are special dynamic actors that are not influenced by forces(such as gravity), and have no momentum. They are considered to have infinite mass and can push regular dynamic actors out of the way. Kinematics will not collide with static or other kinematic objects but are great for moving platforms or characters, where direct motion control is desired.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.LinearDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'drag' force added to reduce linear movement. Linear damping can be used to slow down an object. The higher the drag the more the object slows down.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AngularDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'drag' force added to reduce angular movement. Angular damping can be used to slow down the rotation of an object. The higher the drag the more the rotation slows down.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.EnableSimulation
member.summary: If true simulation and collisions detection will be enabled for the rigidbody.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UseCCD
member.summary: If true Continuous Collision Detection (CCD) will be used for this component.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.EnableGravity
member.summary: If object should have the force of gravity applied.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.StartAwake
member.summary: If object should start awake, or if it should initially be sleeping.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UpdateMassWhenScaleChanges
member.summary: If true, it will update mass when actor scale changes.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MaxAngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angular velocity that a simulated object can achieve. The angular velocity of rigidbodies is clamped to MaxAngularVelocity to avoid numerical instability with fast rotating bodies. Because this may prevent intentional fast rotations on objects such as wheels, you can override this value per rigidbody.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.OverrideMass
member.summary: Override the auto computed mass.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass value measured in kilograms (use override value only if OverrideMass is checked).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MassScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the per-instance scaling of the mass.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CenterOfMassOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the user specified offset for the center of mass of this object, from the calculated location.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Constraints
member.summary: Gets or sets the object movement constraint flags that define degrees of freedom are allowed for the simulation of object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.LinearVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear velocity of the rigidbody.
member.remarks: It's used mostly to get the current velocity. Manual modifications may result in unrealistic behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular velocity of the rigidbody measured in radians per second.
member.remarks: It's used mostly to get the current angular velocity. Manual modifications may result in unrealistic behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MaxDepenetrationVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depenetration velocity when rigidbody moving out of penetrating state.
member.remarks: This value controls how much velocity the solver can introduce to correct for penetrations in contacts. Using this property can smooth objects moving out of colliding state and prevent unstable motion.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.SleepThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass-normalized kinetic energy threshold below which an actor may go to sleep.
member.remarks: Actors whose kinetic energy divided by their mass is below this threshold will be candidates for sleeping.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CenterOfMass
member.summary: Gets the center of the mass in the local space.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.IsSleeping
member.summary: Determines whether this rigidbody is sleeping.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Sleep
member.summary: Forces a rigidbody to sleep (for at least one frame).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.WakeUp
member.summary: Forces a rigidbody to wake up.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UpdateMass
member.summary: Updates the actor's mass (auto calculated mass from density and inertia tensor or overriden value).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddForce(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the world space to the rigidbody at its center of mass.
member.remarks:
This will not induce any torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddForceAtPosition(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the world space to the rigidbody at given position in the world space.
member.remarks:
Also applies appropriate amount of torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the world space.
The position of the force/impulse in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddRelativeForce(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the local space of the rigidbody (relative to its coordinate system) at its center of mass.
member.remarks:
This will not induce any torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the local space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddTorque(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies an impulsive torque defined in the world space to the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an angular acceleration and an angular velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse inertia and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The torque to apply defined in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddRelativeTorque(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies an impulsive torque defined in the local space of the rigidbody (relative to its coordinate system).
member.remarks:
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an angular acceleration and an angular velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse inertia and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The torque to apply defined in the local space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.SetSolverIterationCounts(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the solver iteration counts for the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
The solver iteration count determines how accurately joints and contacts are resolved. If you are having trouble with jointed bodies oscillating and behaving erratically, then setting a higher position iteration count may improve their stability.
If intersecting bodies are being depenetrated too violently, increase the number of velocity iterations. More velocity iterations will drive the relative exit velocity of the intersecting objects closer to the correct value given the restitution.
Default: 4 position iterations, 1 velocity iteration.
member.param: The minimum number of position iterations the solver should perform for this body.
The minimum number of velocity iterations the solver should perform for this body.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.ClosestPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Gets a point on one of the colliders attached to the attached that is closest to a given location. Can be used to find a hit location or position to apply explosion force or any other special effects.
member.param: The position to find the closest point to it.
The result point on the rigidbody shape that is closest to the specified location.

member.summary: If checked, the negative throttle value will be used as brake and reverse to behave in a more arcade style where holding reverse also functions as brake. Disable it for more realistic driving controls.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.SetThrottle(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the input for vehicle throttle. It is the analog accelerator pedal value in range (0,1) where 1 represents the pedal fully pressed and 0 represents the pedal in its rest state.
member.param: The value (-1,1 range). When using UseReverseAsBrake it can be negative and will be used as brake and backward driving.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.SetSteering(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the input for vehicle steering. Steer is the analog steer value in range (-1,1) where -1 represents the steering wheel at left lock and +1 represents the steering wheel at right lock.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.SetBrake(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the input for vehicle brakes. Brake is the analog brake pedal value in range (0,1) where 1 represents the pedal fully pressed and 0 represents the pedal in its rest state.

member.summary: Sets the input for vehicle handbrake. Handbrake is the analog handbrake value in range (0,1) where 1 represents the handbrake fully engaged and 0 represents the handbrake in its rest state.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.SetTankLeftThrottle(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the input for tank left track throttle. It is the analog accelerator pedal value in range (-1,1) where 1 represents the pedal fully pressed to move to forward, 0 to represents the pedal in its rest state and -1 represents the pedal fully pressed to move to backward. The track direction will be inverted if the vehicle current gear is rear.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.SetTankRightThrottle(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the input for tank right track throttle. It is the analog accelerator pedal value in range (-1,1) where 1 represents the pedal fully pressed to move to forward, 0 to represents the pedal in its rest state and -1 represents the pedal fully pressed to move to backward. The track direction will be inverted if the vehicle current gear is rear.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.SetTankLeftBrake(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the input for tank brakes the left track. Brake is the analog brake pedal value in range (0,1) where 1 represents the pedal fully pressed and 0 represents the pedal in its rest state.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.SetTankRightBrake(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the input for tank brakes the right track. Brake is the analog brake pedal value in range (0,1) where 1 represents the pedal fully pressed and 0 represents the pedal in its rest state.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings
member.summary: Vehicle differential settings.

member.summary: Type of differential.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.FrontRearSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between front and rear (higher then 0.5 means more to front, smaller than 0.5 means more to rear). Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and Open4W.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.FrontLeftRightSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between front-left and front-right (higher then 0.5 means more to front-left, smaller than 0.5 means more to front-right). Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and Open4W and LimitedSlipFrontDrive.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.RearLeftRightSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between rear-left and rear-right (higher then 0.5 means more to rear-left, smaller than 0.5 means more to rear-right). Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and Open4W and LimitedSlipRearDrive.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.CentreBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of average front wheel rotation speed and rear wheel rotation speeds. The differential will divert more torque to the slower wheels when the bias is exceeded. Only applied to LimitedSlip4W.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.FrontBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of front-left and front-right wheel rotation speeds. The differential will divert more torque to the slower wheel when the bias is exceeded. Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and LimitedSlipFrontDrive.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.RearBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of rear-left and rear-right wheel rotation speeds. The differential will divert more torque to the slower wheel when the bias is exceeded. Only applied to LimitedSlip4W and LimitedSlipRearDrive.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.DifferentialSettings.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.GearboxSettings
member.summary: Vehicle gearbox settings.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.GearboxSettings.AutoGear
member.summary: If enabled the vehicle gears will be changes automatically, otherwise it's fully manual.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.GearboxSettings.ForwardGearsRatios
member.summary: Number of gears to move to forward

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.GearboxSettings.SwitchTime
member.summary: Time it takes to switch gear. Specified in seconds (s).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.GearboxSettings.ClutchStrength
member.summary: Strength of clutch. A stronger clutch more strongly couples the engine to the wheels, while a clutch of strength zero completely decouples the engine from the wheels. Stronger clutches more quickly bring the wheels and engine into equilibrium, while weaker clutches take longer, resulting in periods of clutch slip and delays in power transmission from the engine to the wheels. Specified in kilograms metres-squared per second (kg m^2 s^-1).

member.summary: Vehicle wheel settings.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.Mass
member.summary: Combined mass of the wheel and the tire in kg. Typically, a wheel has mass between 20Kg and 80Kg but can be lower and higher depending on the vehicle.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.Radius
member.summary: Distance in metres between the center of the wheel and the outside rim of the tire. It is important that the value of the radius closely matches the radius of the render mesh of the wheel. Any mismatch will result in the wheels either hovering above the ground or intersecting the ground.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.Width
member.summary: Full width of the wheel in metres. This parameter has no bearing on the handling but is a very useful parameter to have when trying to render debug data relating to the wheel/tire/suspension.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.MaxSteerAngle
member.summary: Max steer angle that can be achieved by the wheel (in degrees, -180 to 180).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.WheeledVehicle.Wheel.DampingRate
member.summary: Damping rate applied to wheel. Specified in kilograms metres-squared per second (kg m^2 s^-1).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the sphere, measured in the object's local space. The sphere radius will be scaled by the actor's world scale.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the capsule, measured in the object's local space. The capsule height will be scaled by the actor's world scale.

member.summary: Gets or sets the slope limit (in degrees). Limits the collider to only climb slopes that are less steep (in degrees) than the indicated value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the non-walkable mode for the character controller.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.StepOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the step height. The character will step up a stair only if it is closer to the ground than the indicated value. This should not be greater than the Character Controller’s height or it will generate an error.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.UpDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the character up vector.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.MinMoveDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum move distance of the character controller. The minimum traveled distance to consider. If traveled distance is smaller, the character doesn't move. This is used to stop the recursive motion algorithm when remaining distance to travel is small.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Velocity
member.summary: Gets the linear velocity of the Character Controller. This allows tracking how fast the character is actually moving, for instance when it is stuck at a wall this value will be the near zero vector.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.IsGrounded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this character was grounded during last move call grounded.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Flags
member.summary: Gets the current collision flags. Tells which parts of the character capsule collided with the environment during the last move call. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.SimpleMove(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character with the given speed. Gravity is automatically applied. It will slide along colliders. Result collision flags is the summary of collisions that occurred during the Move.
member.returns: The collision flags. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Move(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character using a 'collide-and-slide' algorithm. Attempts to move the controller by the given displacement vector, the motion will only be constrained by collisions. It will slide along colliders. Result collision flags is the summary of collisions that occurred during the Move. This function does not apply any gravity.
member.returns: The collision flags. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.summary: Specifies which sides a character is colliding with.

member.summary: The character is not colliding.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.CollisionFlags.Sides
member.summary: The character is colliding to the sides.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.CollisionFlags.Above
member.summary: The character has collision above.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.CollisionFlags.Below
member.summary: The character has collision below.

member.summary: Specifies how a character controller interacts with non-walkable parts.

member.summary: Stops character from climbing up non-walkable slopes, but doesn't move it otherwise.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.NonWalkableModes.PreventClimbingAndForceSliding
member.summary: Stops character from climbing up non-walkable slopes, and forces it to slide down those slopes.

member.summary: The physical material used to define the collider physical properties.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.IsTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'IsTrigger' flag. A trigger doesn't register a collision with an incoming Rigidbody. Instead, it sends OnTriggerEnter and OnTriggerExit message when a rigidbody enters or exits the trigger volume.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.Center
member.summary: Gets or sets the center of the collider, measured in the object's local space.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.ContactOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the contact offset. Colliders whose distance is less than the sum of their ContactOffset values will generate contacts. The contact offset must be positive. Contact offset allows the collision detection system to predictively enforce the contact constraint even when the objects are slightly separated.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.ComputePenetration(FlaxEngine.Collider,FlaxEngine.Collider,FlaxEngine.Vector3@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Computes minimum translational distance between two geometry objects. Translating the first collider by direction * distance will separate the colliders apart if the function returned true. Otherwise, direction and distance are not defined. The one of the colliders has to be BoxCollider, SphereCollider CapsuleCollider or a convex MeshCollider. The other one can be any type. If objects do not overlap, the function can not compute the distance and returns false.
member.param: The computed direction along which the translation required to separate the colliders apart is minimal. Valid only if function returns true.
The penetration distance along direction that is required to separate the colliders apart. Valid only if function returns true.
member.returns: True if the distance has successfully been computed, i.e. if objects do overlap, otherwise false.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType
member.summary: A storage data type.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.ConvexMesh
member.summary: A convex polyhedron represented as a set of vertices and polygonal faces. The number of vertices and faces of a convex mesh is limited to 255.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.TriangleMesh
member.summary: A collision triangle mesh consists of a collection of vertices and the triangle indices.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags
member.summary: Set of flags used to generate model convex mesh. Allows to customize process.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.SkipValidation
member.summary: Disables the convex mesh validation to speed-up hull creation. Creating a convex mesh with invalid input data without prior validation may result in undefined behavior.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.UsePlaneShifting
member.summary:
Enables plane shifting vertex limit algorithm.
Plane shifting is an alternative algorithm for the case when the computed hull has more vertices than the specified vertex limit.
The default algorithm computes the full hull, and an OBB around the input vertices. This OBB is then sliced with the hull planes until the vertex limit is reached. The default algorithm requires the vertex limit to be set to at least 8, and typically produces results that are much better quality than are produced by plane shifting.
When plane shifting is enabled, the hull computation stops when vertex limit is reached.The hull planes are then shifted to contain all input vertices, and the new plane intersection points are then used to generate the final hull with the given vertex limit.Plane shifting may produce sharp edges to vertices very far away from the input cloud, and does not guarantee that all input vertices are inside the resulting hull. However, it can be used with a vertex limit as low as 4.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.UseFastInteriaComputation
member.summary: Inertia tensor computation is faster using SIMD code, but the precision is lower, which may result in incorrect inertia for very thin hulls.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.ShiftVertices
member.summary: Convex hull input vertices are shifted to be around origin to provide better computation stability. It is recommended to provide input vertices around the origin, otherwise use this flag to improve numerical stability.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.SuppressFaceRemapTable
member.summary: If checked, the face remap table is not created. This saves a significant amount of memory, but disabled ability to remap the cooked collision geometry into original mesh using raycast hit info.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.FastCook
member.summary: The combination of flags that improve the collision data cooking performance at the cost of quality and features. Recommend for runtime dynamic or deformable objects that need quick collision updates.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType
member.summary: Type of drives that can be used for moving or rotating bodies attached to the joint.
member.remarks:
Each drive is an implicit force-limited damped spring: force = spring * (target position - position) + damping * (targetVelocity - velocity)
Alternatively, the spring may be configured to generate a specified acceleration instead of a force.
A linear axis is affected by drive only if the corresponding drive flag is set.There are two possible models for angular drive : swing / twist, which may be used to drive one or more angular degrees of freedom, or slerp, which may only be used to drive all three angular degrees simultaneously.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.X
member.summary: Linear movement on the X axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Y
member.summary: Linear movement on the Y axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Z
member.summary: Linear movement on the Z axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Swing
member.summary: Rotation around the Y axis using the twist/swing angular drive model. Should not be used together with Slerp mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Twist
member.summary: Rotation around the Z axis using the twist/swing angular drive model. Should not be used together with Slerp mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Slerp
member.summary: Rotation using spherical linear interpolation. Uses the SLERP angular drive mode which performs rotation by interpolating the quaternion values directly over the shortest path (applies to all three axes, which they all must be unlocked).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.MAX
member.summary: The count of items in the D6JointDriveType enum.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive
member.summary: Specifies parameters for a drive that will attempt to move the joint bodies to the specified drive position and velocity.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Stiffness
member.summary: The spring strength. Force proportional to the position error.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Damping
member.summary: Damping strength. Force proportional to the velocity error.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.ForceLimit
member.summary: The maximum force the drive can apply.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Acceleration
member.summary: If true the drive will generate acceleration instead of forces. Acceleration drives are easier to tune as they account for the masses of the actors to which the joint is attached.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6Joint
member.summary: Physics joint that is the most customizable type of joint. This joint type can be used to create all other built-in joint types, and to design your own custom ones, but is less intuitive to use. Allows a specification of a linear constraint (for example for a slider), twist constraint (rotating around X) and swing constraint (rotating around Y and Z). It also allows you to constrain limits to only specific axes or completely lock specific axes.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Joint
member.summary: A base class for all Joint types. Joints constrain how two rigidbodies move relative to one another (for example a door hinge). One of the bodies in the joint must always be movable (non-kinematic and non-static).
member.remarks: Joint constraint is created between the parent physic actor (rigidbody, character controller, etc.) and the specified target actor.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Joint.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.summary: Occurs when a joint gets broken during simulation.

member.summary: The target actor for the joint. It has to be IPhysicsActor type (eg. RigidBody or CharacterController).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.BreakForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the break force. Determines the maximum force the joint can apply before breaking. Broken joints no longer participate in physics simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.BreakTorque
member.summary: Gets or sets the break torque. Determines the maximum torque the joint can apply before breaking. Broken joints no longer participate in physics simulation.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange
member.summary: Represents a joint limit between two distance values. Lower value must be less than the upper value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.ContactDist
member.summary: Distance from the limit at which it becomes active. Allows the solver to activate earlier than the limit is reached to avoid breaking the limit.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Restitution
member.summary: Controls how do objects react when the limit is reached, values closer to zero specify non-elastic collision, while those closer to one specify more elastic (i.e bouncy) collision. Must be in [0, 1] range.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Spring
member.summary: The spring that controls how are the bodies pulled back towards the limit when they breach it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Lower
member.summary: The lower distance of the limit. Must be less than upper.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Upper
member.summary: The upper distance of the limit. Must be more than lower.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.Default
member.summary: The default .

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a hard limit. Once the limit is reached the movement of the attached bodies will come to a stop.
member.param: The lower distance of the limit. Must be less than upper.
The upper distance of the limit. Must be more than lower.
Distance from the limit at which it becomes active. Allows the solver to activate earlier than the limit is reached to avoid breaking the limit. Specify -1 for the default.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.LimitLinearRange.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,FlaxEngine.SpringParameters,System.Single)
member.summary: Constructs a soft limit. Once the limit is reached the bodies will bounce back according to the restitution parameter and will be pulled back towards the limit by the provided spring.
member.param: The lower distance of the limit. Must be less than upper.
The upper distance of the limit. Must be more than lower.
The spring that controls how are the bodies pulled back towards the limit when they breach it.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.SphericalJoint
member.summary: Physics joint that removes all translational degrees of freedom but allows all rotational degrees of freedom. Essentially this ensures that the anchor points of the two bodies are always coincident. Bodies are allowed to rotate around the anchor points, and their rotation can be limited by an elliptical cone.

member.summary: The friction value of surface, controls how easily things can slide on this surface.

member.summary: The friction combine mode, controls how friction is computed for multiple materials.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.PhysicalMaterial.OverrideFrictionCombineMode
member.summary: If set we will use the FrictionCombineMode of this material, instead of the FrictionCombineMode found in the Physics settings.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.PhysicalMaterial.Restitution
member.summary: The restitution or 'bounciness' of this surface, between 0 (no bounce) and 1 (outgoing velocity is same as incoming).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.PhysicalMaterial.RestitutionCombineMode
member.summary: The restitution combine mode, controls how restitution is computed for multiple materials.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.PhysicalMaterial.OverrideRestitutionCombineMode

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.PhysicalMaterial.Density
member.summary: Physical material density in kilograms per cubic meter (kg/m^3). Higher density means a higher weight of the object using this material. Wood is around 700, water is 1000, steel is around 8000.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.PhysicalMaterial.Tag
member.summary: Physical material tag used to identify it (eg. `Surface.Wood`). Can be used to play proper footstep sounds when walking over object with that material.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Physics.DefaultScene

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Physics.Scenes
member.summary: List with all physics scenes (readonly).

member.summary: Checks if physical simulation is running.

member.summary: Finds an existing or creates it if it does not exist.

member.summary: Finds an existing scene.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Physics.Simulate(System.Single)
member.summary: Called during main engine loop to start physic simulation. Use CollectResults after.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Physics.CollectResults
member.summary: Called during main engine loop to collect physic simulation results and apply them as well as fire collision events.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Physics.FlushRequests
member.summary: Flushes any latent physics actions (eg. object destroy, actor add/remove to the scene, etc.).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Physics.LineCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a line between two points in the scene.
member.param: The start position of the line.
The end position of the line.
The layer mask used to filter the results.
If set to true triggers will be hit, otherwise will skip them.
member.returns: True if ray hits an matching object, otherwise false.

member.param: The height of the capsule, excluding the top and bottom spheres.
The normalized direction in which cast a capsule.
The result hits. Valid only when method returns true.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
The layer mask used to filter the results.
If set to true triggers will be hit, otherwise will skip them.
member.returns: True if capsule hits an matching object, otherwise false.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.PhysicsBroadPhaseType
member.summary: Broad phase algorithm used in the simulation.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsBroadPhaseType.SweepAndPrune
member.summary: 3-axes sweep-and-prune. Good generic choice with great performance when many objects are sleeping.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsBroadPhaseType.MultiBoxPruning
member.summary: Alternative broad phase algorithm that does not suffer from the same performance issues as SAP when all objects are moving or when inserting large numbers of objects.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsBroadPhaseType.AutomaticBoxPruning
member.summary: Revisited implementation of MBP, which automatically manages broad-phase regions.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsBroadPhaseType.ParallelAutomaticBoxPruning
member.summary: Parallel implementation of ABP. It can often be the fastest (CPU) broadphase, but it can use more memory than ABP.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.PhysicsSolverType
member.summary: The type of solver used in the simulation.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsSolverType.ProjectedGaussSeidelIterativeSolver
member.summary: The iterative sequential impulse solver.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsSolverType.TemporalGaussSeidelSolver
member.summary: Non linear iterative solver. This kind of solver can lead to improved convergence and handle large mass ratios, long chains and jointed systems better. It is slightly more expensive than the default solver and can introduce more energy to correct joint and contact errors.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics
member.summary: Physics simulation statistics container for profiler.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.ActiveDynamicBodies
member.summary: Number of active dynamic bodies for the current simulation step. Does not include active kinematic bodies.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.ActiveKinematicBodies
member.summary: Number of active kinematic bodies for the current simulation step.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.ActiveJoints
member.summary: Number of active joints object for the current simulation step.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.StaticBodies
member.summary: Number of static bodies for the current simulation step.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.DynamicBodies
member.summary: Number of dynamic bodies for the current simulation step.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.KinematicBodies
member.summary: Number of kinematic bodies for the current simulation step.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.NewPairs
member.summary: Number of new pairs found during this frame.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.LostPairs
member.summary: Number of lost pairs during this frame.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.NewTouches
member.summary: Number of new touches found during this frame.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsStatistics.LostTouches
member.summary: Number of lost touches during this frame.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode
member.summary: Enumeration that determines the way in which two material properties will be combined to yield a friction or restitution coefficient for a collision.
member.remarks: Physics doesn't have any inherent combinations because the coefficients are determined empirically on a case by case basis. However, simulating this with a pairwise lookup table is often impractical. The effective combine mode for the pair is maximum(material0.combineMode, material1.combineMode).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Average
member.summary: Uses the average value of the touching materials: (a+b)/2.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Minimum
member.summary: Uses the smaller value of the touching materials: min(a,b)

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the values of the touching materials: a*b

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PhysicsCombineMode.Maximum
member.summary: Uses the larger value of the touching materials: max(a, b)

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ForceMode
member.summary: Force mode type determines the exact operation that is carried out when applying the force on a rigidbody.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Force
member.summary: Add a continuous force to the rigidbody, using its mass. The parameter has unit of mass * distance / time^2, i.e. a force.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Impulse
member.summary: Add an instant force impulse to the rigidbody, using its mass. The parameter has unit of mass * distance / time.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.VelocityChange
member.summary: Add an instant velocity change to the rigidbody, ignoring its mass. The parameter has unit of distance / time, i.e. the effect is mass independent: a velocity change.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ForceMode.Acceleration
member.summary: Add a continuous acceleration to the rigidbody, ignoring its mass. The parameter has unit of distance / time^2, i.e. an acceleration. It gets treated just like a force except the mass is not divided out before integration.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints
member.summary: Dynamic rigidbodies movement and rotation locking flags. Provide a mechanism to lock motion along/around a specific axis or set of axes to constrain object motion.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.None
member.summary: No constraints.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionX
member.summary: Freeze motion along the X-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionY
member.summary: Freeze motion along the Y-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPositionZ
member.summary: Freeze motion along the Z-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationX
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the X-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationY
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the Y-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotationZ
member.summary: Freeze rotation along the Z-axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockPosition
member.summary: Freeze motion along all axes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockRotation
member.summary: Freeze rotation along all axes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RigidbodyConstraints.LockAll
member.summary: Freeze rotation and motion along all axes.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.RayCastHit
member.summary: Raycast hit result data.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RayCastHit.Collider
member.summary: The collider that was hit.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RayCastHit.Material
member.summary: The physical material of the surface that was hit.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RayCastHit.Normal
member.summary: The normal of the surface the ray hit.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RayCastHit.Distance
member.summary: The distance from the ray's origin to the hit location.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RayCastHit.Point
member.summary: The point in the world space where ray hit the collider.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RayCastHit.FaceIndex
member.summary: The index of the face that was hit. Valid only for convex mesh (polygon index), triangle mesh (triangle index) and height field (triangle index).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.RayCastHit.UV
member.summary: The barycentric coordinates of hit triangle. Valid only for triangle mesh and height field.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.FileSystem.ShowOpenFileDialog(FlaxEngine.Window,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String[]@)
member.summary: Displays a standard dialog box that prompts the user to open a file(s).
member.param: The file filter string as null-terminated pairs of name and list of extensions. Multiple file extensions must be separated with semicolon.
True if allow multiple files to be selected, otherwise use single-file mode.
The output names of the files picked by the user.
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Example file filters: "All Files\0*.*" "All Files\0*.*\0Image Files\0*.png;*.jpg"

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.FileSystem.ShowSaveFileDialog(FlaxEngine.Window,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String[]@)
member.summary: Displays a standard dialog box that prompts the user to save a file(s).
member.param: The file filter string as null-terminated pairs of name and list of extensions. Multiple file extensions must be separated with semicolon.
True if allow multiple files to be selected, otherwise use single-file mode.
The output names of the files picked by the user.
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Example file filters: "All Files\0*.*" "All Files\0*.*\0Image Files\0*.png;*.jpg"

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.FileSystem.ShowBrowseFolderDialog(FlaxEngine.Window,System.String,System.String,System.String@)

member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.MaxAnisotropy
member.summary: The maximum number of samples that can be used to improve the quality of sample footprints that are anisotropic. Higher values improve texturing but reduce performance. Limited by GPU capabilities and used only if SamplerFilter is Anisotropic.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.Quality
member.summary: The quality scale factor applied to textures in this group. Can be used to increase or decrease textures resolution. In the range 0-1 where 0 means lowest quality, 1 means full quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.QualityIfInvisible
member.summary: The quality scale factor applied when texture is invisible for some time (defined by TimeToInvisible). Used to decrease texture quality when it's not rendered.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.TimeToInvisible
member.summary: The time (in seconds) after which texture is considered to be invisible (if it's not rendered by a certain amount of time).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.MipLevelsMin
member.summary: The minimum amount of loaded mip levels for textures in this group. Defines the amount of the mips that should be always loaded. Higher values decrease streaming usage and keep more mips loaded.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.MipLevelsMax
member.summary: The maximum amount of loaded mip levels for textures in this group. Defines the maximum amount of mips that can be loaded. Overriden per-platform. Lower values reduce texture quality and improve performance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.TextureGroup.MipLevelsBias
member.summary: The loaded mip levels bias for textures in this group. Can be used to increase or decrease the quality of streaming for textures in this group (eg. bump up the quality during cinematic sequence).

member.summary: The default .

member.summary: Gets the chunk material that overrides the terrain default one.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchHeightMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,System.Single*,System.Byte*,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The height map array length. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.
The height map. Each array item contains a height value.
The holes mask (optional). Normalized to 0-1 range values with holes mask per-vertex. Must match the heightmap dimensions.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchSplatMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,System.Int32,FlaxEngine.Color32*,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch layer weights using the specified splatmaps data.
member.param: The zero-based index of the splatmap texture.
The splatmap map array length. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.
The splat map. Each array item contains 4 layer weights.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.Setup(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Setups the terrain. Clears the existing data.
member.param: The LODs count. The actual amount of LODs may be lower due to provided chunk size (each LOD has 4 times less quads).
The size of the chunk (amount of quads per edge for the highest LOD). Must be power of two minus one (eg. 63 or 127).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.AddPatches(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Adds the patches to the terrain (clears existing ones).
member.param: The number of patches (x and z axis).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.AddPatch(FlaxEngine.Int2@)
member.summary: Adds the patch.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.Single@,FlaxEngine.TerrainChunk@,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this terrain collision shape. Returns the hit chunk.
member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.
The raycast result hit position distance from the ray origin. Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The raycast result hit chunk. Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Ray,System.Single@,FlaxEngine.Int2@,FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this terrain collision shape. Returns the hit chunk.
member.param: The raycast result hit position distance from the ray origin. Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The raycast result hit terrain patch coordinates (x and z). Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The raycast result hit terrain chunk coordinates (relative to the patch, x and z). Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.summary: Various defines regarding terrain configuration.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.Config.ChunksCount
member.summary: The maximum allowed amount of chunks per patch.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.Config.ChunksCountEdge
member.summary: The maximum allowed amount of chunks per chunk.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.UnitsPerVertex
member.summary: The constant amount of units per terrain geometry vertex (can be adjusted per terrain instance using non-uniform scale factor).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.MaxLODs
member.summary: The maximum amount of levels of detail for the terrain chunks.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.PatchChunksCount
member.summary: The constant amount of terrain chunks per terrain patch object.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.PatchEdgeChunksCount
member.summary: The constant amount of terrain chunks on terrain patch object edge.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Terrain.MaxSplatmapsCount
member.summary: The terrain splatmaps amount limit. Each splatmap can hold up to 4 layer weights.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchHeightMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Single[],System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The patch location (x and z coordinates).
The height map. Each array item contains a height value (2D inlined array). It should has size equal (chunkSize*4+1)^2.
The holes mask (optional). Normalized to 0-1 range values with holes mask per-vertex. Must match the heightmap dimensions.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchSplatMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,FlaxEngine.Color32[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The patch location (x and z coordinates).
The zero-based index of the splatmap texture.

The splat map. Each array item contains 4 layer weights. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).
member.returns: True if failed, otherwise false.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Resets the reading position to the text beginning.

member.summary: Indicates if the current position is at the end of the current document.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.ParseNext(FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlTag@,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the next tag that matches the specified tag name.
member.param: Returns information on the next occurrence of the specified tag or null if none found.
Name of the tags to parse (null to parse all tags).
member.returns: True if a tag was parsed or false if the end of the document was reached.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.ParseTag(FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlTag@,System.String)
member.summary: Parses the contents of an HTML tag. The current position should be at the first character following the tag's opening less-than character.
member.remarks: We parse to the end of the tag even if this tag was not requested by the caller. This ensures subsequent parsing takes place after this tag.
member.param: Returns information on this tag if it's one the caller is requesting.
Name of the tags to parse (null to parse all tags).
member.returns: True if data is being returned for a tag requested by the caller or false otherwise.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.ParseTagName
member.summary: Parses a tag name. The current position should be the first character of the name.
member.returns: Returns the parsed name string.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.ParseAttributeName
member.summary: Parses an attribute name. The current position should be the first character of the name.
member.returns: Returns the parsed name string.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.ParseAttributeValue
member.summary: Parses an attribute value. The current position should be the first non-whitespace character following the equal sign.
member.remarks: We terminate the name or value if we encounter a new line. This seems to be the best way of handling errors such as values missing closing quotes, etc.
member.returns: Returns the parsed value string.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.MoveToNextTag
member.summary: Moves to the start of the next tag.
member.returns: True if another tag was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.Peek(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the character at the specified number of characters beyond the current position, or a null character if the specified position is at the end of the document.
member.param: The number of characters beyond the current position.
member.returns: The character at the specified position.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.Move(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the current position ahead the specified number of characters.
member.param: The number of characters to move ahead.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.SkipWhitespace
member.summary: Moves the current position to the next character that is not whitespace.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Utilities.HtmlParser.NormalizePosition
member.summary: Normalizes the current position. This is primarily for handling conditions where IndexOf(), etc. return negative values when the item being sought was not found.

member.summary: Determines whether the video clip should autoplay on level start.

member.summary: Determines the time (in seconds) at which the video clip starts playing if Play On Start is enabled.

member.summary: Determines whether the video clip should loop when it finishes playing.

member.summary: If checked, video player us using spatialization to play 3d audio, otherwise will always play as 2d sound.

member.summary: Gets or sets the volume of the audio played from this video, in [0, 1] range.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.AudioPan
member.summary: Gets or sets the stereo pan of the played audio (-1 is left speaker, 1 is right speaker, 0 is balanced). The default is 0. Used by non-spatial audio only.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.AudioMinDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance at which audio attenuation starts. When the listener is closer to the video player than this value, audio is heard at full volume. Once farther away the audio starts attenuating. Used by spatial audio only.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.AudioAttenuation
member.summary: Gets or sets the attenuation that controls how quickly does audio volume drop off as the listener moves further from the video player. Used by spatial audio only.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of the video playback (playing/paused/stopped).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets the current time of playback. The time is in seconds, in range [0, Duration].

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.Duration
member.summary: Gets the media duration of playback (in seconds). Valid only when media was loaded by the video backend.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.FrameRate
member.summary: Gets the media frame rate of playback (amount of frames to be played per second). Valid only when media was loaded by the video backend.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.FramesCount
member.summary: Gets the amount of video frames decoded and send to GPU during playback. Can be used to detect if video has started playback with any visible changes (for video frame texture contents). Valid only when media was loaded by the video backend.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.Size
member.summary: Gets the video frame dimensions (in pixels). Valid only when media was loaded by the video backend.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.VideoPlayer.Frame
member.summary: Gets the video frame texture (GPU resource). Created on the playback start. Can be binded to materials and shaders to display the video image.

member.summary: Starts playing the currently assigned video Url.

member.summary: Stops video playback, rewinding it to the start.

member.returns: The 8 corners of the frustum

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.BoundingFrustum.GetZoomToExtentsShiftDistance(FlaxEngine.Vector3[])
member.summary: Get the distance which when added to camera position along the lookat direction will do the effect of zoom to extents (zoom to fit) operation, so all the passed points will fit in the current view. if the returned value is positive, the camera will move toward the lookat direction (ZoomIn). if the returned value is negative, the camera will move in the reverse direction of the lookat direction (ZoomOut).
member.returns: The zoom to fit distance

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.BoundingFrustum.GetZoomToExtentsShiftDistance(FlaxEngine.BoundingBox@)
member.summary: Get the distance which when added to camera position along the lookat direction will do the effect of zoom to extents (zoom to fit) operation, so all the passed points will fit in the current view. if the returned value is positive, the camera will move toward the lookat direction (ZoomIn). if the returned value is negative, the camera will move in the reverse direction of the lookat direction (ZoomOut).
member.returns: The zoom to fit distance

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.BoundingFrustum.GetZoomToExtentsShiftVector(FlaxEngine.Vector3[])
member.summary: Get the vector shift which when added to camera position will do the effect of zoom to extents (zoom to fit) operation, so all the passed points will fit in the current view.
member.returns: The zoom to fit vector

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CollisionsHelper.RayIntersectsPoint(FlaxEngine.Ray@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)

member.returns: Whether the two objects intersect.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CollisionsHelper.RayIntersectsRay(FlaxEngine.Ray@,FlaxEngine.Ray@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the point of intersection, or if there was no intersection.
member.returns: Whether the two objects intersect.
member.remarks: This method performs a ray vs ray intersection test based on the following formula from Goldman. s = det([o_2 - o_1, d_2, d_1 x d_2]) / ||d_1 x d_2||^2 t = det([o_2 - o_1, d_1, d_1 x d_2]) / ||d_1 x d_2||^2 Where o_1 is the position of the first ray, o_2 is the position of the second ray, d_1 is the normalized direction of the first ray, d_2 is the normalized direction of the second ray, det denotes the determinant of a matrix, x denotes the cross product, [ ] denotes a matrix, and || || denotes the length or magnitude of a vector.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CollisionsHelper.RayIntersectsPlane(FlaxEngine.Ray@,FlaxEngine.Plane@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the distance of the intersection, or 0 if there was no intersection.
member.returns: Whether the two objects intersect.

member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a .

member.returns: Whether the two objects intersected.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CollisionsHelper.RayIntersectsTriangle(FlaxEngine.Ray@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@,System.Single@)
member.summary: Determines whether there is an intersection between a and a triangle.
member.param: The first vertex of the triangle to test.
The second vertex of the triangle to test.
The third vertex of the triangle to test.
When the method completes, contains the distance of the intersection, or 0 if there was no intersection.
member.returns: Whether the two objects intersected.
member.remarks: This method tests if the ray intersects either the front or back of the triangle. If the ray is parallel to the triangle's plane, no intersection is assumed to have happened. If the intersection of the ray and the triangle is behind the origin of the ray, no intersection is assumed to have happened. In both cases of assumptions, this method returns false.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.FloatR11G11B10
member.summary: Packed vector, layout: R:11 bytes, G:11 bytes, B:10 bytes. The 3D vector is packed into 32 bits as follows: a 5-bit biased exponent and 6-bit mantissa for x component, a 5-bit biased exponent and 6-bit mantissa for y component, a 5-bit biased exponent and a 5-bit mantissa for z. The z component is stored in the most significant bits and the x component in the least significant bits. No sign bits so all partial-precision numbers are positive. (Z10Y11X11): [32] ZZZZZzzz zzzYYYYY yyyyyyXX XXXxxxxx [0]

The floating point value that should be stored in B component (10 bits format).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Mathd
member.summary: A collection of common math functions on double floating-points.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Epsilon
member.summary: The value for which all absolute numbers smaller than are considered equal to zero.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Pi
member.summary: A value specifying the approximation of π which is 180 degrees.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Mathd.TwoPi
member.summary: A value specifying the approximation of 2π which is 360 degrees.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Mathd.PiOverTwo
member.summary: A value specifying the approximation of π/2 which is 90 degrees.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Mathd.PiOverFour
member.summary: A value specifying the approximation of π/4 which is 45 degrees.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Mathd.GoldenRatio
member.summary: A value specifying the golden mean

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Abs(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the absolute value of f.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Acos(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the arc-cosine of f - the angle in radians whose cosine is f.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Approximately(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compares two floating point values if they are similar.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Asin(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the arc-sine of f - the angle in radians whose sine is f.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Atan(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the arc-tangent of f - the angle in radians whose tangent is f.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Atan2(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the angle in radians whose Tan is y/x.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Ceil(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the smallest integer greater to or equal to f.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.CeilToInt(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the smallest integer greater to or equal to f.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Saturate(System.Double)
member.summary: Clamps value between 0 and 1 and returns value.
member.returns: Result value

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Cos(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the cosine of angle f in radians.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.DeltaAngle(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the shortest difference between two given angles given in degrees.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Exp(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns e raised to the specified power.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Floor(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the largest integer smaller to or equal to f.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.FloorToInt(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the largest integer smaller to or equal to f.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Remap(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Remaps the specified value from the specified range to another.
member.returns: The remapped value.

member.summary: Calculates the linear parameter t that produces the interpolation value within the range [a, b].

member.summary: Same as Lerp but makes sure the values interpolate correctly when they wrap around 360 degrees.

member.summary: Returns the logarithm of a specified number in a specified base.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.Min(System.Double[])

member.summary:
The same as but is more computation intensive with large and has better accuracy with large .
cost of this function is %
member.returns: Valid angle in radians.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.UnwindDegrees(System.Double)
member.summary: Utility to ensure angle is between +/- 180 degrees by unwinding.

member.returns: Valid angle in degrees.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Mathd.UnwindDegreesAccurate(System.Double)
member.summary:

The same as but is more computation intensive with large and has better accuracy with large .
cost of this function is %

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Vector2.TransformCoordinate(FlaxEngine.Vector2@,FlaxEngine.Matrix@,FlaxEngine.Vector2@)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Vector2.TransformCoordinate(FlaxEngine.Vector2,FlaxEngine.Matrix)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.returns: The transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Vector2.TransformNormal(FlaxEngine.Vector2@,FlaxEngine.Matrix@,FlaxEngine.Vector2@)
member.summary: Performs a normal transformation using the given .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the transformed normal.
member.remarks: A normal transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is zero. This causes the fourth row and fourth column of the matrix to be unused. The end result is a vector that is not translated, but all other transformation properties apply. This is often preferred for normal vectors as normals purely represent direction rather than location because normal vectors should not be translated.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Vector2.TransformNormal(FlaxEngine.Vector2,FlaxEngine.Matrix)
member.summary: Performs a normal transformation using the given .

The end result is a vector that is not translated, but all other transformation properties apply. This is often preferred for normal vectors as normals purely represent direction rather than location because normal vectors should not be translated.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Vector3.TransformCoordinate(FlaxEngine.Vector3@,FlaxEngine.Matrix@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Vector3.TransformCoordinate(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Matrix)
member.summary: Performs a coordinate transformation using the given .
member.returns: The transformed coordinates.
member.remarks: A coordinate transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is one. The four dimensional vector obtained from the transformation operation has each component in the vector divided by the w component. This forces the w component to be one and therefore makes the vector homogeneous. The homogeneous vector is often preferred when working with coordinates as the w component can safely be ignored.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Vector3.TransformNormal(FlaxEngine.Vector3@,FlaxEngine.Matrix@,FlaxEngine.Vector3@)
member.summary: Performs a normal transformation using the given .
member.param: When the method completes, contains the transformed normal.
member.remarks: A normal transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is zero. This causes the fourth row and fourth column of the matrix to be unused. The end result is a vector that is not translated, but all other transformation properties apply. This is often preferred for normal vectors as normals purely represent direction rather than location because normal vectors should not be translated.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Vector3.TransformNormal(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Matrix)
member.summary: Performs a normal transformation using the given .
member.returns: The transformed normal.
member.remarks: A normal transform performs the transformation with the assumption that the w component is zero. This causes the fourth row and fourth column of the matrix to be unused. The end result is a vector that is not translated, but all other transformation properties apply. This is often preferred for normal vectors as normals purely represent direction rather than location because normal vectors should not be translated.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Assertions.Assert.AreApproximatelyEqual(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Asserts that the values are approximately equal. An absolute error check is used for approximate equality check (|a-b| < tolerance). Default tolerance is 0.00001f. Note: Every time you call the method with tolerance specified, a new instance of Assertions.Comparers.FloatComparer is created. For performance reasons you might want to instance your own comparer and pass it to the AreEqual method. If the tolerance is not specifies, a default comparer is used and the issue does not occur.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Object.Destroy(FlaxEngine.Object,System.Single)
member.summary: Destroys the specified object and clears the reference variable. The object obj will be destroyed now or after the time specified in seconds from now. If obj is a Script it will be removed from the Actor and deleted. If obj is an Actor it will be removed from the Scene and deleted as well as all its Scripts and all children of the Actor. Actual object destruction is always delayed until after the current Update loop, but will always be done before rendering.
member.param: The time left to destroy object (in seconds).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Object.DestroyNow(FlaxEngine.Object)
member.summary: Destroys the specified object and clears the reference variable. The object obj will be destroyed immediately. If obj is a Script it will be removed from the Actor and deleted. If obj is an Actor it will be removed from the Scene and deleted as well as all its Scripts and all children of the Actor.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Object.Destroy``1(``0@,System.Single)
member.summary: Destroys the specified object and clears the reference variable. The object obj will be destroyed now or after the time specified in seconds from now. If obj is a Script it will be removed from the Actor and deleted. If obj is an Actor it will be removed from the Scene and deleted as well as all its Scripts and all children of the Actor. Actual object destruction is always delayed until after the current Update loop, but will always be done before rendering.
member.param: The time left to destroy object (in seconds).

member.summary: Checks if the 3D canvas intersects with a given 3D mouse ray.

True if perform precise intersection test against the control content (eg. with hit mask or transparency threshold). Otherwise, only simple bounds-check will be performed.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler
member.summary: UI canvas scaling component for user interface that targets multiple different game resolutions (eg. mobile screens).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ScalingMode
member.summary: Canvas scaling modes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ScalingMode.ConstantPixelSize
member.summary: Applies constant scale to the whole UI in pixels.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ScalingMode.ConstantPhysicalSize
member.summary: Applies constant scale to the whole UI in physical units (depends on the screen DPI). Ensures the UI will have specific real-world size no matter the screen resolution.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ScalingMode.ScaleWithResolution
member.summary: Applies min/max scaling to the UI depending on the screen resolution. Ensures the UI size won't go below min or above max resolution to maintain it's readability.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ScalingMode.ScaleWithDpi
member.summary: Applies scaling curve to the UI depending on the screen DPI.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.PhysicalUnitMode
member.summary: Physical unit types for canvas scaling.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.PhysicalUnitMode.Centimeters
member.summary: Centimeters (0.01 meter).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.PhysicalUnitMode.Millimeters
member.summary: Millimeters (0.1 centimeter, 0.001 meter).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.PhysicalUnitMode.Inches
member.summary: Inches (2.54 centimeters).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.PhysicalUnitMode.Points
member.summary: Points (1/72 inch, 1/112 of pica).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.PhysicalUnitMode.Picas
member.summary: Pica (1/6 inch).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionScalingMode
member.summary: Resolution scaling modes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionScalingMode.ShortestSide
member.summary: Uses the shortest side of the screen to scale the canvas for min/max rule.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionScalingMode.LongestSide
member.summary: Uses the longest side of the screen to scale the canvas for min/max rule.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionScalingMode.Horizontal
member.summary: Uses the horizontal (X, width) side of the screen to scale the canvas for min/max rule.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionScalingMode.Vertical
member.summary: Uses the vertical (Y, height) side of the screen to scale the canvas for min/max rule.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.CurrentScale
member.summary: Gets the current UI scale. Computed based on the setup when performing layout.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.Scaling
member.summary: The UI Canvas scaling mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ScaleFactor
member.summary: The UI Canvas scale. Applied in all scaling modes for custom UI sizing.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.PhysicalUnit
member.summary: The UI Canvas physical unit to use for scaling via PhysicalUnitSize. Used only in ConstantPhysicalSize mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.PhysicalUnitSize
member.summary: The UI Canvas physical unit value. Used only in ConstantPhysicalSize mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionMode
member.summary: The UI Canvas resolution scaling mode. Controls min/max resolutions usage in relation to the current screen resolution to compute the UI scale. Used only in ScaleWithResolution mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionMin
member.summary: The UI Canvas minimum resolution. If the screen has lower size, then the interface will be scaled accordingly. Used only in ScaleWithResolution mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionMax
member.summary: The UI Canvas maximum resolution. If the screen has higher size, then the interface will be scaled accordingly. Used only in ScaleWithResolution mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.ResolutionCurve
member.summary: The UI Canvas scaling curve based on screen resolution - shortest/longest/vertical/horizontal (key is resolution, value is scale factor). Clear keyframes to skip using it and follow min/max rules only. Used only in ScaleWithResolution mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.GUI.CanvasScaler.DpiCurve
member.summary: The UI Canvas scaling curve based on screen DPI (key is DPI, value is scale factor). Used only in ScaleWithDpi mode.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Updates the scaler for the current setup.
