member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode
member.summary: The canvas rendering modes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.ScreenSpace
member.summary: The screen space rendering mode that places UI elements on the screen rendered on top of the scene. If the screen is resized or changes resolution, the Canvas will automatically change size to match this.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.CameraSpace
member.summary: The camera space rendering mode that places Canvas in a given distance in front of a specified Camera. The UI elements are rendered by this camera, which means that the Camera settings affect the appearance of the UI. If the Camera is set to Perspective, the UI elements will be rendered with perspective, and the amount of perspective distortion can be controlled by the Camera Field of View. If the screen is resized, changes resolution, or the camera frustum changes, the Canvas will automatically change size to match as well.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.WorldSpace
member.summary: The world space rendering mode that places Canvas as any other object in the scene. The size of the Canvas can be set manually using its Transform, and UI elements will render in front of or behind other objects in the scene based on 3D placement. This is useful for UIs that are meant to be a part of the world. This is also known as a 'diegetic interface'.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.WorldSpaceFaceCamera
member.summary: The world space rendering mode that places Canvas as any other object in the scene and orients it to face the camera. The size of the Canvas can be set manually using its Transform, and UI elements will render in front of or behind other objects in the scene based on 3D placement. This is useful for UIs that are meant to be a part of the world. This is also known as a 'diegetic interface'.

member.summary: PostFx used to render the . Used when render mode is or .

member.summary: The game content cooking keycode. Use the same value for a game and DLC packages to support loading them by the build game. Use 0 to randomize it during building.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.ForDistribution
member.summary: If checked, the builds produced by the Game Cooker will be treated as for final game distribution (eg. for game store upload). Builds done this way cannot be tested on console devkits (eg. Xbox One, Xbox Scarlett). Enabled by default for `Release` builds.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.SkipPackaging
member.summary: If checked, the output build files won't be packaged for the destination platform. Useful when debugging build from local PC.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.AdditionalAssets
member.summary: The list of additional assets to include into build (into root assets set).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.AdditionalScenes
member.summary: The list of additional scenes to include into build (into root assets set).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.AdditionalAssetFolders
member.summary: The list of additional folders with assets to include into build (into root assets set). Paths relative to the project directory (or absolute).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.ShadersNoOptimize
member.summary: Disables shaders compiler optimizations in cooked game. Can be used to debug shaders on a target platform or to speed up the shaders compilation time.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.ShadersGenerateDebugData
member.summary: Enables shader debug data generation for shaders in cooked game (depends on the target platform rendering backend).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.SkipDefaultFonts
member.summary: If checked, skips bundling default engine fonts for UI. Use if to reduce build size if you don't use default engine fonts but custom ones only.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.SkipDotnetPackaging
member.summary: If checked, .NET Runtime won't be packaged with a game and will be required by user to be installed on system upon running game build. Available only on supported platforms such as Windows, Linux and macOS.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.BuildSettings.SkipUnusedDotnetLibsPackaging
member.summary: If checked, .NET Runtime packaging will skip unused libraries from packaging resulting in smaller game builds.

member.name: T:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings
member.summary: Graphics rendering settings.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.UseVSync
member.summary: Enables rendering synchronization with the refresh rate of the display device to avoid "tearing" artifacts.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.AAQuality
member.summary: Anti Aliasing quality setting.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.SSRQuality
member.summary: Screen Space Reflections quality setting.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.SSAOQuality
member.summary: Screen Space Ambient Occlusion quality setting.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.VolumetricFogQuality
member.summary: Volumetric Fog quality setting.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.ShadowsQuality
member.summary: The shadows quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.ShadowMapsQuality
member.summary: The shadow maps quality (textures resolution).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.AllowCSMBlending
member.summary: Enables cascades splits blending for directional light shadows. [Deprecated in v1.9]

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.DefaultProbeResolution
member.summary: Default probes cubemap resolution (use for Environment Probes, can be overriden per-actor).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.UseHDRProbes
member.summary: If checked, Environment Probes will use HDR texture format. Improves quality in very bright scenes at cost of higher memory usage.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.EnableGlobalSDF
member.summary: If checked, enables Global SDF rendering. This can be used in materials, shaders, and particles.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.GlobalSDFDistance
member.summary: Draw distance of the Global SDF. Actual value can be large when using DDGI.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.GlobalSDFQuality
member.summary: The Global SDF quality. Controls the volume texture resolution and amount of cascades to use.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.GIQuality
member.summary: The Global Illumination quality. Controls the quality of the GI effect.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.GIProbesSpacing
member.summary: The Global Illumination probes spacing distance (in world units). Defines the quality of the GI resolution. Adjust to 200-500 to improve performance and lower frequency GI data.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.GICascadesBlending
member.summary: Enables cascades splits blending for Global Illumination.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.GlobalSurfaceAtlasResolution
member.summary: The Global Surface Atlas resolution. Adjust it if atlas `flickers` due to overflow (eg. to 4096).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.PostProcessSettings
member.summary: The default Post Process settings. Can be overriden by PostFxVolume on a level locally, per camera or for a whole map.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.FallbackFonts
member.summary: The list of fallback fonts used for text rendering. Ignored if empty.

member.name: P:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.GraphicsSettings.UeeHDRProbes
member.summary: Renamed UeeHDRProbes into UseHDRProbes [Deprecated on 12.10.2022, expires on 12.10.2024]

member.summary: The target amount of the physics simulation updates per second (also fixed updates frequency).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.TimeSettings.DrawFPS
member.summary: The target amount of the frames rendered per second (actual game FPS).

member.summary: The game time scale factor. Default is 1.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.TimeSettings.MaxUpdateDeltaTime

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.InputSettings.ActionMappings
member.summary: Maps a discrete button or key press events to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to event-driven behavior. The end effect is that pressing (and/or releasing) a key, mouse button, or keypad button.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.InputSettings.AxisMappings
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.

member.summary: Game localization and internalization settings container.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.LocalizationSettings.LocalizedStringTables
member.summary: The list of the string localization tables used by the game.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.LocalizationSettings.DefaultFallbackLanguage
member.summary: The default fallback language to use if localization system fails to pick the system locale language (eg. en-GB).

member.name: T:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings
member.summary: The navigation system settings container.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.AutoAddMissingNavMeshes
member.summary: If checked, enables automatic navmesh actors spawning on a scenes that are using it during navigation building.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.AutoRemoveMissingNavMeshes
member.summary: If checked, enables automatic navmesh actors removing from a scenes that are not using it during navigation building.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.CellHeight
member.summary: The height of a grid cell in the navigation mesh building steps using heightfields. A lower number means higher precision on the vertical axis but longer build times.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.CellSize
member.summary: The width/height of a grid cell in the navigation mesh building steps using heightfields. A lower number means higher precision on the horizontal axes but longer build times.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.TileSize
member.summary: Tile size used for Navigation mesh tiles, the final size of a tile is CellSize*TileSize.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.MinRegionArea
member.summary: The minimum number of cells allowed to form isolated island areas.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.MergeRegionArea
member.summary: Any regions with a span count smaller than this value will, if possible, be merged with larger regions.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.MaxEdgeLen
member.summary: The maximum allowed length for contour edges along the border of the mesh.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.MaxEdgeError
member.summary: The maximum distance a simplified contour's border edges should deviate from the original raw contour.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.DetailSamplingDist
member.summary: The sampling distance to use when generating the detail mesh.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.MaxDetailSamplingError
member.summary: The maximum distance the detail mesh surface should deviate from heightfield data.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.NavMeshes
member.summary: The configuration for navmeshes.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.NavAreas
member.summary: The configuration for nav areas.

member.name: M:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NavigationSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NetworkSettings
member.summary: Network settings container.

member.name: M:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NetworkSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NetworkSettings.MaxClients
member.summary: Maximum amount of active network clients in a game session. Used by server or host to limit amount of players and spectators.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NetworkSettings.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: Network protocol version of the game. Network clients and server can use only the same protocol version (verified upon client joining).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NetworkSettings.NetworkFPS
member.summary: The target amount of the network system updates per second. Higher values provide better network synchronization (eg. 60 for shooters), lower values reduce network usage and performance impact (eg. 30 for strategy games). Can be used to tweak networking performance impact on game. Cannot be higher that UpdateFPS (from Time Settings). Use 0 to run every game update.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NetworkSettings.Address
member.summary: Address of the server (server/host always runs on localhost). Only IPv4 is supported.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NetworkSettings.Port
member.summary: The port for the network peer.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.NetworkSettings.NetworkDriver
member.summary: The type of the network driver (implements INetworkDriver) that will be used to create, manage, send and receive messages over the network.

member.name: T:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings
member.summary: Physics simulation settings container.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.DefaultGravity
member.summary: The default gravity force value (in cm^2/s).

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.BounceThresholdVelocity
member.summary: Minimum relative velocity required for an object to bounce. A typical value for simulation stability is about 0.2 * gravity

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.FrictionCombineMode
member.summary: Default friction combine mode, controls how friction is computed for multiple materials.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.RestitutionCombineMode
member.summary: Default restitution combine mode, controls how restitution is computed for multiple materials.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.DisableCCD
member.summary: If true CCD will be ignored. This is an optimization when CCD is never used which removes the need for physics to check it internally.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.BroadPhaseType
member.summary: Broad phase algorithm to use in the simulation.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.EnableEnhancedDeterminism
member.summary: Enables enhanced determinism in the simulation. This has a performance impact.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.SolverType
member.summary: The solver type to use in the simulation.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.MaxDeltaTime
member.summary: The maximum allowed delta time (in seconds) for the physics simulation step.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.EnableSubstepping
member.summary: Whether to substep the physics simulation.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.SubstepDeltaTime
member.summary: Delta time (in seconds) for an individual simulation substep.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.MaxSubsteps
member.summary: The maximum number of substeps for physics simulation.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.SupportCookingAtRuntime
member.summary: Enables support for cooking physical collision shapes geometry at runtime. Use it to enable generating runtime terrain collision or convex mesh colliders.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.TriangleMeshTriangleMinAreaThreshold
member.summary: Triangles from triangle meshes (CSG) with an area less than or equal to this value will be removed from physics collision data. Set to less than or equal 0 to disable.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.QueriesHitTriggers
member.summary: If enabled, any Raycast or other scene query that intersects with a Collider marked as a Trigger will returns with a hit. Individual raycasts can override this behavior.

member.name: F:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.LayerMasks
member.summary: The collision layers masks. Used to define layer-based collision detection.

member.name: M:FlaxEditor.Content.Settings.PhysicsSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
